Negocio que inicio desde muy joven por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo para poder mantener en aquel momento a sus pequeños hijos como madre soltera. En la actualidad su carga familiar es mas leve porque sus hijos son independientes. Esta Sra. Ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 y ha demostrado ser responsable, buena paga en tiempo y forma. María del Carmen agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is a 58-year-old single mother of six adult children. She is a resident of the department of Chinandega, a town located in the north of the country. María del Carmen's livelihood for the last 21 years has been a small cafeteria and store. The business is located in her home, and it consists of selling lunch and dinner to students and the general public, as well as merchandise like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. 

She started this business when she was very young out of the need to have a means of working to support her then-small children as a single mother. Currently, her family responsibility is lighter because her children are independent. 

María del Carmen has already worked with Fundación León 2000 and has shown herself to be responsible and reliable in making her loan payments in a timely manner. She appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of life.

loans.use: to invest in her small cafeteria and to buy merchandise like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité tiene 18 integrantes en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican, ya que son mujeres muy emprendedoras, es por ello que el grupo lleva ese nombre. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias.
Laura, la presidenta, comenta que siempre trata de inspirar a sus compañeras a luchar por lo que quieren y a no darse por vencida, ya que todo lo que hacen es por sus familias, para poder darles un futuro digno y sin privaciones. Laura es peluquera y solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su salón, como ser shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, esmaltes, etc, con lo que podrá seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: This group has 18 members who each have an activity to which they are dedicated. They are all very enterprising women, which is how the group got its name. The ladies are very excited because the sense of mutual support is constant and above all, inspires them to keep fighting for their families. Laura, the president, says that she always tries to inspire her friends to fight for what they want and to not give up. Everything that they do is for their families, to be able to give them a good future without deprivation. Laura is a hairstylist, and she is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her salon, like shampoo, hair rinses, dyes, nail polish, etc., so that she can continue to give good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair rinses, dyes, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha, 39, lives with her husband and their four children. She operates a food stall where she sells delicious meals like soups, meat, rice, and salads, among other items. She’s been in business for 4 years and she’s acquired much experience that leads her to earn higher profits. She has quite a number of regular customers because people know that everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices; in addition her service is excellent.

Mwanasha is an enterprising woman who has many future goals. She wants to create a better future and is working hard to do so because she knows that’s the only way to reach success. Like all good merchants, she wants to increase business but needs capital to back her up, which is why she’s asking Yehu for a loan to buy meat, basic grains, vegetables, beverages, etc. Mwanasha has good payment references and is sure that she’ll be able to repay the loan. At the same time, she’s confident that she’ll be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy meat, basic grains, vegetables, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Tiangay

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Tiangay from Torkpoi town in the Southern area of Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 1 year and 13 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Tiangay runs a food stand business; she sells rice, garie and flour. She has been running this business for 6 years. She works at the business every day, even when she goes home, she will sell to the customer. She also receives income from her elder brother and sister because life is very difficult for her.   Tiangay says that the main challenge to her business is the means of finance to support her business.

Tiangay has requested a loan of 800,000 SLL in order to buy a variety of food stock like rice, garie, and flour. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy a variety of food stock like rice, garie, and flour.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es: María Sonia vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas de diferentes diseños, tiene varios años con su trabajo y ha obtenido mucha experiencia  que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, su pequeño negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda en una comunidad muy concurrida de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque sus hamacas son de primera calidad, a precio accesible y con un servicio excelente; María es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor a su trabajo, en los últimos meses aumentaron los encargos de hamacas y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la producción, pero para ello necesita materia prima por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar hilo de colores, nylon, tela, cuerda, etc. María Sonia tiene buenas referencias de pago y  es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Sonia lives together with her partner and her children.  She earns a living making hammocks with different designs.  She has been doing this job for several years and has obtained a lot of experience, which has allowed her to earn better profits.  Her small business is located at her house in a very busy community.  She has gained a lot of customers as the people prefer her because her hammocks are good quality at a reasonable price and she offers excellent service. 

Maria is an entrepreneurial woman, dedicated to her work and she has a great desire to succeed.  She is always looking for new opportunities that will allow her to be successful.  Her biggest secret is strength and love for her work.  In the last few months, orders for hammocks have increased so she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy colored thread, nylon, fabric, rope, etc. 

Maria Sonia has good payment references and she assures that she will be able to repay the debt. At the same time she has faith that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy colored thread, nylon, fabric and rope.

loans.name: Joajura Group

texts.es:
El comité  Joajura través de la capacitación y la ayuda que les da la Fundación, están saliendo adelante y por medio de esa ayuda en conjunta ayudan a sus familias y están saliendo adelante.
Cada una de ellas se esfuerza por sus hijos ya que quieren darles una vida digna y sin privaciones. Una de ellas es Antinia, quien se dedica a la elaboración de todo tipo de cosas por medio del crochet, comenta que desde niña que lo hace y hoy en día es el medio con el que mantiene a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos de colores, agujas y bastidores, con los cuales podrá seguir haciendo sus bordados.
texts.en: The Joajura group is moving forward thanks to the training and support given by the Foundation. Through this aid, the group members are helping their families and getting ahead. Each of the members works to give her children a good life without hardship. One of the members is Antinia, who works in producing all types of things through crochet. She says that she has crocheted since she was a girl, and today it is the way that she supports her family. She is asking for this loan to purchase colored yarns, needles, and embroidery frames, with which she can continue to make her handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy colored yarns, needles, and embroidery frames.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Massah is 50 years old and widowed with five children, between the ages of 16 and 28 years. She runs a cookery business at her house in Kandeh town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells cooked rice, fry soup, and fish.   She also receives income from her elder son. She says that her business is going well; more customers are coming every morning to buy her food. She wakes up at 5:00 am to start to prepare the food, she will not rest until the food finished.  

Massah has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more food commodities like bags of rice, vegetable oil and cooking seasoning. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life and increase her business. In the future, she would like to open a restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food commodities like bags of rice, vegetable oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for sewing to resell.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Mariama from the southern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 10 years and 16 years. Both of her children are currently attending school. 

In 2008, Mariama established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to improve the lives of her family and change her status. She works at the business 9 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and the cost of transportation.

Mariama requires a loan in order to buy more wax cotton and different kinds of clothing material. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, Mariam plans to expand her business to the shop level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton and different kinds of clothing material.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda a sus 33 años lleva un feliz matrimonio con Luis de 33 años tambien, ambos tienen dos pequeños hijos gemelos de 13 años. Con esfuerzo lograron concretar una casa de material noble. Ella siempre dedicada a su familia optó por abrir un pequeño negocio en casa y  desde entonces lidera su tienda de abarrotes. Ya son mas de 14 años que viene desempeñándose como comerciante y como todo negocio ha sufrido el alza de precios por parte de sus proveedores. Considera siempre en seguir con su negocio familiar a pesar de todo, porque es la única manera de poder educar y alimentar a sus hijos. A manera de contrarrestar estos inconvenientes, desea  comprar productos al por mayor y de preferencia no perecibles para seguir con el negocio y generar mas ganancias. Por otro lado, no descarta en absoluto ampliar su negocio con mas productos y más bajos precios, pues se sietne segura de recibir el crédito para cumplir estos objetivos. Hasta el momento ya lleva  06 prestamos con MFP, siempre tratando de cumplir a tiempo y logrando mantener un buen historial, asimismo fomenta el cumplimiento y la responsabilidad en el pago de sus prestamos. Con los 500 soles complementará los productos que le hace falta y tienen mas demanda en su tienda como cereales y conservas.
texts.en:
Erlinda, age 33, is happily married to Luis who is also 33. They have twin sons who are 13 years old. Through great effort, they were able to build a house made of solid materials. Erlinda is always dedicated to her family, so she chose to open a small business in her home. Since then, she has managed her grocery store. For more than 14 years, she has worked as a merchant. However, her business has suffered as a result of the increased prices being charged by her suppliers. Erlinda is always determined to continue her family business despite all of the challenges because this is the only way for her to educate and feed her children.

To overcome these challenges, Erlinda wants to buy products in bulk (preferably nonperishable goods) so that she can continue her business and generate more income. In addition, she does not rule out the possibility of expanding her business by offering more products at lower prices. She feels that the loan will help her accomplish these goals. As of this date, Erlinda has received six loans from MFP. She always tries to complete her payments on time and has maintained a good credit history. Erlinda also advocates compliance with the loan terms and being responsible with one’s payments. This loan of 500 PEN will be used to complete her inventory with products that she is lacking and are more in demand, such as grains and preserves.

loans.use: to buy grains and preserves.

loans.name: Lowotha

texts.en:
Lowotha has been in transport services with his motorbike-taxi business venture for the past three years, and earns a good income which he uses to support his family.  

He wants to pay school fees for his child and has requested a second loan of KES 16,000. His dream is to see his business prosper as well as give his children the best education.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, age 39, is a single lady without children. She lives in a village in Mwambalazi, in the Coast province of Kenya. 

One year ago Joyce decided to have her own source of income in order to contribute to household expenses. She established a convenience store at the market where she sells charcoal.

The loan Joyce is requesting is for 20,000 KES. She will use it to stock her business with more charcoal in order to meet the demand from her customers, and to increase sales. Her wish is for her business to grow.

loans.use: to stock her business with more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Michael Jordan

texts.es: Michael Jordan de 24 años de edad vive en Bolivia - Cochabamba, es soltero y no tiene hijos, estudio hasta el nivel bachillerato no pudo culminar sus estudios, no contaba con mucha economía en su familia así que no pudo ejercer una carrera como él quería, desde muy pequeño él se supo a trabajar así ayudar en su familia y poder pagar su estudios. Michael Jordan trabaja de transportista publico prestando sus servicios a la población de Cochabamba, ya que el corre mucho peligro que hay muchos asaltos y delincuencia para los trasportista, Michael Jordan es trabajador, humilde y responsable. El presente crédito Solicitado por Michael Jordan es para la refacción y reposicion de llantas de su auto ya que no cuenta con muchos ingresos y no puede cubrir los gastos de su mantenimiento, sin embargo él trabaja en esa situación de su auto por que necesita ayudar con los ingresos familiares para que puedan cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
Michael Jordan is 24 years old and lives in Cochabamba, Bolivia. He is single and doesn't have any children. He studied through high school, but he wasn't able to go further. His family didn't have much savings, so he wasn't able to pursue a college degree like he would have liked. 

Since he was very small, he knew how to work to help his family and to pay for his education. Michael Jordan works in public transportation, offering his services to the population of Cochabamba. Even though he is in a lot of danger because there are a lot of assaults and crimes against taxi drivers, Michael Jordan is hardworking, humble, and responsible. 

The current loan requested by Michael Jordan is for car repairs and tire replacement, since he doesn't have much income and can't cover the costs of its maintenance. Nevertheless, he works with his car in that condition because he needs to help with the family income so that they can cover their expenses.

loans.use: to maintain his taxi and buy tires.

loans.name: Marizza

texts.es:
La Señora Marizza es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, ella es soltera y nos cuenta que se dedica al comercio, tiene una pollería en la cual trabaja desde hace 6 años.
Cuenta que al principio fue difícil abrirse camino y ganarse clientela, pero hoy en día ya tiene muy buen prestigio porque sus productos y su atención es muy buena. Gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su familia con los gastos y ella misma genera sus propios ingresos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de equipos de frío para su negocio, ya que ella también vende bebidas y necesita tenerlos siempre frescos para sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en: Ms. Marizza is from the city of Curuguaty. She is single, and tells us that she is dedicated to her business. She has a chicken shop in which she has worked for the past six years. She says that at first it was difficult to get the shop started and build clientele, but today the shop is well known because its products and service are very good. Thanks to her work, Marizza is able to help her family with expenses and also to earn her own money. She is asking for this loan to buy refrigeration equipment for her business, because she also sells beverages and needs to always have them fresh for her customers. She is grateful this opportunity, because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase refrigeration equipment for her chicken shop.

loans.name: Ikatu Group

texts.es:
El grupo “IKATU” es un comité de 16 mujeres que son muy bien organizadas, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen para brindarse apoyo y ayuda unas a otras para seguir mejorando día a día su calidad de vida.
 Estas señoras están animadas por seguir participando de este programa de microcrédito, para así mejorar sus actividades y generar más ingresos. Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Graciela quien hace artesanía en Ao poi, la cual es un tejido típico paraguayo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, telas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías.
texts.en:
The group “Ikatu” is a committee of 16 women who are well-organized, unified, hardworking, and supportive of one another. These women are from the city of Villarrica and are all neighbors and friends. They have joined together so that they can provide support and help one another as they continue to improve their quality of life each day. These women are excited about their continued participation in a microcredit program so that they can improve their businesses and generate more income.

One of these women is Sra. Graciela, who makes crafts from “ao po’i”, a traditional Paraguayan woven fabric. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy thread, needles, fabrics, and other supplies in order to continue producing her crafts.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, fabrics, and other supplies.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Señora Antonia solicita el préstamo para surtir su negocio en comprar más variedad de productos como es juguetes y aparatos electrónicos ya que viene la temporada navideña y sus clientes le están solicitando este tipo de mercancía para vender, y así obtener mayores ganancias.
La señora Antonia es originaria de Nuevo Laredo y es soltera tiene ya mas de seis años dedicándose al negocio de ventas, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella y dos sobrinos que viven con ella a quienes le a estado ayudando para que terminen sus estudio y sea unos profesionales ,tengan un futuro triunfador.
Desea mejorar su negocio y tener mas variedad de mercancía, con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio será para pagar el crédito y que con la renta de un local de fiestas que tiene será para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business with a wider variety of products, such as toys and electrical appliances. With the Christmas season approaching and her customers requesting these types of products, she will be able to generate more income.

Sra. Antonia is originally from Nuevo Laredo. She is single and has been managing her sales business for more than six years. This is the source of income by which she is able to support herself and her two nephews who live with her. Antonio wants to help them finish their studies so that they can become professionals and have a successful future.

Antonio wants to improve her business and have a wider variety of merchandise. With the profit she generates from her business, she will repay the loan. The income she generates from the festivals will be used for her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her business.

loans.name: Tekojoja Group

texts.es:
El Comite Tekojoja esta ubicado en el Chaco, está en su primer ciclo. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Agustina, una de las miembros, comenta que vende perfumes y lenceria. Cuenta que al principio le fue muy difícil, pero luego se abrió camino y se gano una buena clientela para poder cubrir los gastos del día a día por medio de sus ingresos. Quiere seguir trabajando, y de esa forma seguir ayudando a los suyos, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de más perfume, con lo cual podrá tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee “Tekojoja” is located in El Chaco and in its first loan cycle. The members are hardworking women who have learned how to work together and help one another.

Agustina, one of the members, says that she sells perfumes and lingerie. She says that she found things difficult at first, but later on she was able to break through and build up a good clientele to help her generate income to cover her daily expenses. Agustina wants to continue working so that she can help her family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more perfume so that she can have a wider variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco tiene  47 años, está felizmente casado con la señora Maria de 40 años, y tienen la bendición de tener 4 hijos.
El Sr. Francisco es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de Pescados en su casa que los trae de la Ciudad de Ayolas. El tiene como anhelo ampliar su negocio y de tener una sucursal en los alrededores del mercado de abasto de la ciudad, ya que es sus productos son muy solicitados por sus clientes.
El Sr. Francisco solicita el crédito para la compra de mas pescados ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda en la venta desea aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Francisco is 47 years old and is happily married with Maria of 40 years of age. They have been blessed with 4 children. He is a shopkeeper and earns his living selling fish from his house, which he imports from Ciudad de Ayolas. He would like to expand his business, and to have another shop in the outskirts of the city's wholesale market, since his products are in high demand by his customers. 

Francisco is asking for a loan so that he can buy more fish since they are in high demand and he would like to increase his stock

loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Nimio

texts.es:
El Señor Nimio, es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 36 años de edad, es casado. Cuenta que es dueño de una gomería, y también se dedica a la venta de cubiertas nuevas y usadas. Hace 12 años que trabaja sacrificamente en este trabajo y por medio de este da a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Cuenta que su negocio está muy bien ubicado en la ciudad y es por ello que tiene también muy buena clientela, y le ayuda mucho el buen servicio que siempre da a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para compras de cubiertas nuevas y usadas, está muy agradecido por los créditos obtenidos de la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en: Nimio is from the city of Santaní.  He is 36 years old and is married.  He is the owner of a tire repair shop and he also earns a living selling new and used tires.  He has been working sacrificially in this job for twelve years and, as a result, his family has everything they need.  He relies on his business being very well located in the city and, because of that, he has a good clientele.  The good service that he gives to his customers also helps him a lot.  He is requesting a loan to buy new and used tires.  He is very appreciative for the loans obtained from Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy new and used tires to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms. Nasreen is a 50-year-old married woman. She grows and sells vegetables. She has been running this business for the past 5 years with the support of her husband.  She has four children, and her daughter also helps her with growing the vegetables. Her husband helps to sell them door to door and at the local market. She has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides to grow fresh, green vegetables. Nasreen hopes to earn more money and desires to spend it on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides to grow fresh, green vegetables

loans.name: Ansaf

texts.en: Ansaf is a 48-year-old married woman who has two family members and resides in Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy new furniture and some households items to create a comfortable space for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 26-year-old married woman with one child and lives in Madaba, Jordan. She has requested a 600 JOD loan to pay for clothes to sell retail from her home.

Since Safaa is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell retail.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida has been in the embroidery business for over two years. In her childhood, she watched her mother stitch clothes and make beautiful patterns of embroidery for her and her siblings. By the time she grew up, she knew how to stitch, sew and make five different types of stitches, which made her embroidery exclusive and unique from all others in her town. Rashida approached Kashf when she was on the brink of financial disaster and her family could barely garner sufficient resources to feed themselves. Desperate to change her fate and provide relief to her family, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy additional raw materials such as reels of thread and packs of pearls and sequins. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers which ultimately will help generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy additional raw material such as reels of threads and packs of pearls and sequins.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is from Lanchkhuti district, West Georgia. He is 57 years old and lives with his wife and a grown son. Revaz runs an agricultural business. In particular, he owns a nut garden and a vineyard.  He does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. Revaz picks grapes and produces wine and vodka. In addition, Revaz has bee hives with bee colonies and gets honey. He sells his agricultural production at the local open market. Revaz works hard, to make some savings and expand his agricultural business.

He requested a loan to purchase wooden materials and build beehives. Revaz will manage to save money on hives and sell them as well. This will significantly increase the family income. The increased income will be reinvested in his bee-keeping business. Revaz awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials and build beehives

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 59 years old and from the province of Isabela. She is engaged in selling different products for the community. To earn additional income, she is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy a variety of products that she can offer the people of the community. 

In the future, Perla hopes that her business expands so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Basmah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Basmah prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband.

Basmah is a 37-year-old married female from Madaba, Jordan. She has 5 children and requested a 800 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and to buy some furniture. In the future, Basmah wants to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is a diligent person. She is 51 years old and married with three grown children. Perla sells different products in the community. To have additional income, she is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy additional products that she can offer in the community. Perla strives to meet the needs of her family. Her only hope is to see her children in a good condition.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, a box of canned goods and cases of drinks for her store

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amenah is a 55-year-old married woman who has one family member from Madaba, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 300 JOD to pay for her home improvements. She would like to repaint her home and to do maintenance on the home. In the future, she hopes to buy a new furniture.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a 28-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi in Jordan. She has requested an 800 JOD loan to pay for clothes to resell from her own home. In the future, she would like to have her own shop and improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Kholoud is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter has requested a second loan of 20,000 KES to purchase fruits, vegetables, beans and maize for sale. Profit made will aid him in paying his rent and his children's school fees. His dream is to one day purchase a piece of land and build his own house, as well as to see his children get the best education.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruits, beans and maize.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 46 years old, married to Margaret, and blessed with eight children. He sells charcoal. It is a business he started three years ago, and he earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

He has requested a second loan of KES 20,000 to contribute toward him buying a piece of land and building his own home. His dream is to see his business expand as well as to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 40 years old and married to a farmer with four school-aged children. She has been managing a sari-sari store (a community-based store) for 15 years. She needs to have additional income to meet the demands of her customers. She has requested a loan of Php 9,000 to buy additional products to display at her store. She wishes that someday she can reconstruct her house into a better one to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy snacks foods and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en: Wedad is a 44-year-old married woman who has two family members from Al Russeifeh, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to pay for cosmetics products to resell, such as makeup and accessories. She owns a salon. She would like to expand her project. In the future, she wants to buy a new machine for her salon to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics products for resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize and millet to sell at her posho mill

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Kawthar prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her brother.

Kawthar is a 24-year-old married female from Al Hashmi, Jordan. She has a child and requested a 400 JOD loan to pay for clothes to sell from her home. In the future, she would like to have her own shop and improve the living conditions of her family.

Since Kawthar is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: To pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Nayibe

texts.es: Nayibe trabaja en una oficina, pero   no es suficiente el dinero que gana para lograr sus metas,  por eso ella también tiene un negocio, donde vende mercancías mediante guías especializadas o catalogo. Sus principales  productos son los perfumes, maquillaje, bisutería, cremas faciales, desodorantes y talcos, que distribuye entre una clientela conformada  por otros empleados de la oficina, amigos y referidos. Ella empezó este negocio hace 4 años, cuando una amiga que también vendía mercancías la recomendó que empezara vendiendo productos de su catalogo. Ahora ella tiene un buen negocio vendiendo productos de reconocidas marcas, mostrando el catalogo a sus compañeras de trabajo. Uno de sus desafíos en el negocio, es su insuficiente capital, y por eso Nayibe ha solicitado un credikiva, para comprar un mayor número de productos,  para vender, como perfumes, cremas, maquillaje y bisutería, porque es mucha la clientela de cada día que pasa.  Ella espera que con más capital de trabajo, pueda atender la alta demanda alta de sus productos, durante la temporada del amor y amistad, y el fin de año, donde sus ventas usualmente se incrementan y ella lógicamente gana mucho más. Nayibe, de  48 años es madre de 3 hijos,  en las edades de 23 y 27 años; ella tiene como meta más adelante,  aumentar sus ingresos para remodelar su casa, porque para ella tener un lugar seguro y bueno para vivir es muy importante.
texts.en:
Nayibe works in an office, but she doesn’t earn enough money to make ends meet; therefore, she also has a business, where she sells merchandise through specialized guides or catalogs. Her main products are perfumes, makeup, jewelry, facial creams, deodorants and talcum powder, which she distributes among a clientele made up of other office employees, friends, and references. 

She started this business 4 years ago, when a friend who also sells merchandise recommended to her that she start selling products from her catalog. Now she has a good business selling products from well-known brands, showing the catalog to her coworkers. 

One of the challenges in her business is her insufficient capital, and because of this Nayibe has requested a Kiva loan in order to purchase a greater number of products to sell, such as perfumes, creams, makeup and jewelry, because every day a lot of customers come by. 

She hopes that with more working capital she will be able to attend to the high demand for her products, during the Valentine’s Day season and the end of the year, where her sales usually increase and she logically earns much more. 

Nayibe is 48 years old and the mother of 3 children, from the ages of 23 and 27 years. She has as a goal to get further ahead and increase her earnings to remodel her house, because for her, having a place that is safe and good to live is very important.

loans.use: to purchase a greater number of products to sell, like perfumes, creams, makeup and jewelry.

loans.name: Angelita Porfiria

texts.es: Angelita tiene 61 años de edad de estado civil casada tiene 1 hijo de 10 años .Compro una vitrina y perchas de allí ella vende laminas, cuadernos hasta artículos de bazar y pocos víveres. Ella Atiende su pequeño negocio sola. Ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Ella cuenta que al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio  pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando esas condiciones pues ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio y su sueño es ampliarlo más para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que dio a día le compran en su bazar. Y Ella cuenta que quisiera arreglar su vivienda y el sueño de ella es comprarse un carro. Con el préstamo quisiera comprar: artículos para el bazar, papeles, láminas,  etc.
texts.en: Angelita is 61 years old, married, and has a ten year-old son. She bought a display case and shelves from which she sells laminated sheets, notebooks, stationery, and a few grocery items. She tends to her her small business by herself. She starts work at 8:00 am and goes until 10:00 pm. She says that at first, her area had a lot of crime and her business was not very productive, but little by little these conditions have been improving and now her business is going very well. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can satisfy the needs of the customers who buy from her each day. Angelita also says that she would like to fix up her house and that her dream is to buy a car. With this loan, she would like to buy stationery items, paper, laminated sheets, etc.

loans.use: to buy stationery items, paper, laminated sheets, etc.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina has been selling vegetables and fruits for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has requested a second loan of KES 59,500 to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

The anticipated profit from the business will help her build rental houses for additional income. Her dream is to be successful in life and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Nadia prefers that her photo not appear on the Internet. Thus, the above photo is of her husband. Nadia is a 33-year-old married woman who has two family members. She is from Al Hashmi Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to buy various products to resell such as clothes, perfumes and blankets. She would like to increase her products. She wants, in the future, to open a shop to show her products to increase her income

loans.use: to buy various products to resell

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antolina; la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo, quinua, garbanzos y habas, la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de productos secos al por mayor como trigo y maiz.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata"; the bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

This partner is Antolina; she continues with her business selling dry goods like wheat, quinoa, garbanzos, and beans. She sells in one of the markets in the city of Cusco from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She’s been in this business for years, which goes well, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day, being that this is the way that she gets her family ahead. 

This partner requests the loan for the purchase of dry goods in bulk, such as wheat and corn.

She is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way, and she is committed to making the loan payments in the established time.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods in bulk, such as wheat and corn.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 34 years old, married to Evans, and blessed with two children. She sells fish; a business she started eight years ago, and from which, earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has requested for a second loan of KES 50,000 to buy more fish to sell. Her profit will help her to open up a cereals store. Her dream is to be successful in the business world.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is twenty-five years old and she lives with her life partner and their two children. She has been engaging in tailoring for three years, and thanks to her experience she is able to create the best items of clothing. She works according to her customers’ tastes; sewing shirts, blouses and dresses among other clothes. She tries to keep up-to-date with her very good styles and her first-quality products. She already has many customers, as people prefer her because of her excellent service and affordable prices.

Margaret is a determined woman, devoted to her job. She is a tenacious person, always waiting for new chances that will allow her to achieve her goals.  She is ready to work very hard to succeed. She wants to expand her activity because of the recent increase in requests that she receives. As she needs money to do this, she is requesting a loan to Yehu to buy fabric, threads and needles at wholesale prices. She hopes she will succeed in granting a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more beans and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old, married to Esther and blessed with a seven-year-old child. He owns a carpentry workshop, a business he ventured in five years ago and he earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

He has requested a second loan of KES 85,000 to purchase a motorbike to venture into this line of business. His profit will be ploughed back into his businesses. His dream is to become successful.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a new business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a 30-year-old single mother of one school-age daughter. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional products for her store to have more items to offer in the community. Being a single mother, she needs to work hard to supply all the needs of her daughter. She hopes to have her own house so that she can give more convenient living to her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase spices, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and beverages for her store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 38, is a mother of three children who are attending a primary school. She had a charcoal selling business which has provided her with the opportunity to progress in life. To continue helping her husband in the daily expenses, Fatuma decided to start a food stall that is located at the market center. The business has been doing well. Her dream is to have a hotel in future. She narrates that price fluctuations are a major challenge she faces.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of KSH 35,000 to buy ingredients such as beans, rice, flour, flavorings, etc. Fatuma hopes to improve her living standards. Thanks to the loans she is receiving from Kiva through Yehu, she is sure that they will boost her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as beans, rice, flour, and flavorings, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruit, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Mwendwa

texts.en: Mwendwa used his previous loan to buy timber and nails. He made and sold more furniture and hence, made more income.  He used the additional income from the business to buy more timber.  He has requested another loan of 20,000 KES to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia wants to request a loan of PHP 16,000 to purchase pigs and sacks of rice, which she and her husband will sell in their neighborhood.

Sylvia wants her family to be always healthy and strong, especially in facing life's difficulties. Of course, she also wants to improve her business so that it will become stable.

Having her happy and loving family, Sylvia seems to be already fulfilled with her life but according to her, nothing is permanent in life. Thus, she must strive harder and look for better opportunities that will improve her family's life. One of these opportunities is to venture into businesses which will guarantee more income opportunities.

At 52, Sylvia is more attentive than when she was younger. She is married to Lucas, who is not only her partner in life but also her business partner. Their children are Reynaldo, who did not graduate from college, and Nomar, who is 25 years old and a nursing graduate but who is unemployed due to lack of employment opportunities in the province.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 29 years old married to David and blessed with two children, aged six and three years respectively. She runs a retail shop; a business she started four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 40,000 to purchase cooking oil, a sack of each rice and sugar, and bales of maize flour.

Her profit will be ploughed back to her business. Her dream is to see this shop grow into a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, a sack of each rice and sugar and bales of maize flour.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria viene de un municipio al sur de Barranquilla, llamado Santo Tomas, pero hace 8 años tuvo que mudarse a Puerto Colombia, un pueblo en la costa a orillas del mar Caribe;  porque  su esposo trabaja con una cadena de droguerías y le asignaron la administración de esas droguerías en Puerto Colombia. Ahora, ayuda a él, con los ingresos procedentes de  la venta de productos cosméticos entre otros mediante un catálogo, y también vende mercancía que compra independientemente en el centro de Barranquilla,  como jeans, camisas, calzado y bolsos.  Además, ella tiene una distribuidora de periódicos y cuenta con 4 vendedores. Todos estos negocios la ayuda a proveer bienestar para sus dos hijos de 14 y 16 años, y ella normalmente obtiene una margen de utilidad no menor del 35%. Victoria está aplicando a un credikiva, su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para poder comprar mercancías en descuentos y en mayor volumen, tanto del catalogo   como la que compra independientemente. Victoria espera poder seguir ampliando su negocio, y también quiere terminar de remodelar su vivienda para que sea segura y cómoda para su familia y todos disfruten de un ambiente muy confortable.
texts.en:
Victoria comes from a municipality south of Barranquilla called Santo Tomas, but eight years ago she had to move to Puerto Colombia, a coastal town on the shores of the Caribbean Sea, because her husband works for a chain of drugstores and was assigned to manage the stores in Puerto Colombia. Now, Victoria helps him with her income from selling cosmetics and other products by catalog. She also sells merchandise that she buys independently in Barranquilla, such as jeans, shirts, shoes and bags. She also has a newspaper distribution business with four salespeople. All of these businesses help Victoria to provide for the well-being of her two children, ages 14 and 16 years old. She normally obtains a margin of utility of no less than 35 percent. 

Victoria is applying for a "credikiva" -- her first funding through Fundación Santo Domingo -- in order to buy merchandise at a discount and in greater quantities, both from catalogs and through her independent purchases. Victoria hopes to be able to continue expanding her business and she also wants to finish remodeling her house to make it safe and comfortable for her family so that they can all enjoy a comfortable environment.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at a discount and in greater volumes

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Forjadoras de  Sueños” perteneciente a la  ciudad de Rancagua.
Ella se dedica al rubro de repostería, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja arrendando un local y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, desempeñándose de lunes a sábado, realiza tortas, pasteles, pan, y  a la vez ofrece otros productos para vender como bebidas, helados, dulces, ya que se encuentra cerca de un colegio y aprovecha de vender todos sus productos.
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en diferentes distribuidoras e importadoras y locales donde encuentra mercadería para realizar su repostería a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará vajilla, chocolates, bolsas y un toldo, para abastecer su negocio.
Una de las metas de Karina es arrendar otro local mas grande, y abastecerlo de mas articulos y mercadería para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Karina vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 11, 7 y 1 año de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es tener un local más grande y abastecerlo de otros articulos, y a nivel familiar ver que sus hijos tengan buenos estudios y que tengan un buen pasar. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Communal Bank “Forjadora de Sueños” (Forger of Dreams) which is located in the city of Rancagua. She has been making pastries for two years. Karina says that she works out of rented storefront and her distribution schedule is based according to her availability. She works Monday through Saturday producing cakes, pastries, and bread. Sometimes she offers other products to sell such as beverages, frozen treats, and candy. Her business is located near a school, so she takes advantage of this in order to sell all of her products.

Her supplies are purchased in the city of Santiago from various distributors, importers, and shops that carry products for baking at low cost, thus making it financially convenient for her. With this loan Karina will buy vanilla, chocolates, and bags to restock her business. She will also buy an overhead canopy. One of Karina’s goals is to rent a much larger location and stock it with more products and merchandise to generate more income. As a result, she will be able to achieve a better quality of life.

Karina lives with her husband and three children (ages 11, 7, and 1). Her dreams for her business include having a larger shop and stocking with other products. In terms of her family, she hopes to see her children do well in their studies so that they can make their way in life. She is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable working with the other entrepreneurs in her Communal Bank with whom she shares various activities and interests. The meetings also provide her with a moment of distraction. With regard to the training classes conducted during their meetings, Karina has learned how to do a better job of managing her business.

Rancagua is part of the Libertador Bernardo O’Higgins region. This modern city is one of the main producers and exporters of fruits and wine in Chile. It is also a mining city because it is the home of “El Teniente”, one of the largest underground mines in the world with 4500 kilometers of tunnels.

loans.use: to buy vanilla, chocolates, bags, and an overhead canopy for her business.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité " Primavera" tiene 12 miembros, donde todas ellas agradecen a la Fundación por la oportunidad que les da y por confiar en ellas ya que son mujeres  trabajadoras, dicen que se esforzaran al máximo por ayudar a sus familias y seguir creciendo con el grupo.
Carolina es parte del grupo y comenta que se dedica a la costura, es una modista muy talentosa y sabe lo que hace. Lleva un tiempo trabajando en esto y gracias a eso se ha hecho de buena clientela que siempre va a ella a darle trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, gomas y demás insumos. Ella agradece la oportunidad que reciben, pues les será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee named “Primavera” (Spring) has 12 members. They are all grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for trusting them and giving them this opportunity. The members are hardworking women who say that they do their best to help their families and continue growing as a group.

Carolina is part of this group and says that she earns her living by sewing. She is a very talented seamstress and knowledgeable in what she does. Carolina has been working for some time and thanks to her efforts, she has built up a good customer base that always provides her with work to do. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, rubber, and other supplies. Carolina is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, rubber, and other supplies.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es soltera y no tiene hijos; ella vive en la casa de sus padres, ocupando una habitación en acabado de adobe y pisos de tierra; la casa está ubicada en la zona 23 de Marzo de la ciudad de El Alto. 
Silvia trabaja como empleada en una Empresa de transportadores en la zona Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudió hasta terminar la secundaria y actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que con sus ingresos debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago  de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material como estuco, pintura, para terminar la obra fina de su habitación ya que las paredes son de adobe y desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Silvia es mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse y tener más comodidad.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Silvia is single and does not have children. She lives in her parents' house in a room made of adobe with dirt floors. The house is located in teh 23 de Marzo aera of the city of El Alto.  

Silvia works as an employee of a transportation company in the Rió Seco of the city of El Alto. She studied and finished secondary school and she currently works more than eight hours per day as she needs to make an income to cover food costs and basic services for her family. 

She needs this loan to purchase materials like stucco and paint to finish remodeling her room as the walls are made of adobe and she wants a better quality of life. Silvia's dream is to improve her income so that she can become independent and have more comfort. This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stucco and paint to finish remodling the room where she lives.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two school going children. Faith owns a clothes business which she has been operating for three years though she works as a hawker. In this business she sells shawls, brassieres, pants etc. 

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are competition and lack of funds. 

Faith is applying for a loan of 21050 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help pay for her children’s school fees. Her dream is to open a larger boutique.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,ella tiene un terreno dodne siembra papa y verduras como zanahorias,tomates y zapallos y luego lo vende en el mercado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta  las 5:00 p.m,la socia por tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,su esposo hace servicio de taxi,la socia ya tiene en el negocio de agricultura 8 años y le por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos.La socia solicita le credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su tierra de cultivo.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to make her living in agriculture. She has a plot of land where she plants potatoes and vegetables like carrots, tomatoes, and pumpkins. She then sells these at the market. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She also makes a living in transportation. Her husband has a taxi service. She has worked in agriculture for eight years and has helped get her children ahead with this work. 

She needs this loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She is very thankful and appreciates her loan through this process. She has committed to comply with discipline as she has with her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Leon

texts.es:
León, es casado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales todos ya son independientes, viven en casa propia con su esposa y su padre que es mayor de edad, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió solo hasta técnico medio de diseñador grafico y actualmente trabaja elaborando pasteles y empanadas junto a su esposa, en un ambiente destinado para tal efecto.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su pastelería ya que las paredes se encuentran muy deterioradas (va a comprar estuco, ladrillos, pintura) y también para la compra de insumos (harina, azúcar, leche, levadura, etc.).
El sueño de León es construir más habitaciones en su casa para poder acoger a sus hijos y ampliar su pastelería.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
León is married and has three children who are all independent . He lives in his own home with his wife and his elderly father. The house is located in the Cota Cota area of the city of La Paz. 

He studied up until a technical degree in graphic design and he currently works making cakes and empanadas together with his wife in a location set up for that. 

He needs this loan to repair the bakery as the walls are quite deteriorated. He will buy stucco, bricks, and paint, as well as supplies such as flour, sugar, milk, yeast, etc. León's dream is to build more rooms in his house so that he can house his children and expand his bakery. This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stucco, bricks, and paint to repair the walls of his bakery as well as to purchase supplies like flour, sugar, milk, etc. to continue his business of making cakes and empanadas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more curios.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa lives in Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a retail shop for selling coconuts, tomatoes, fish, charcoal, etc. and the business has been operating for two years. She started the business through her personal savings. 

Jumwa learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Jumwa is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock like coconut, tomatoes, fish, charcoal, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her pay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop in a larger business premise.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like coconut, tomatoes, fish, charcoal etc.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La  Srta.  Liliana tiene 23 años, es  soltera y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, ella es hija de un comerciante muy conocido en la zona, ella desde muy pequeña empezó a trabajar con él en su negocio, y con su ayuda pudo montar su propio negocio que es la compra y ventas de ropas de todo tipo y marca. Actualmente ya tiene clientela formada en la zona y así aumenta su pedido de prendas, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ya pudo construirse una pequeña casita.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de Camisa, remera, short, y otros que en esta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Liliana is 23, she is single and lives in the city of Carapeguá, she is a daughter of a well-known trader in the area. From a young age, Liliana started working with her father in the business, and with his help, she was able to set up her own business buying and selling clothes of all types and brands. She currently has a steady customer base in the area, and that is how her orders for clothes have risen. Thanks to her hard work and dedication she has already built her own small home.

She is seeking this loan to buy shirts, T-shirts, shorts and others which are in what a lot of her customers are asking for.

loans.use: to buy shirts, T-shirts, shorts and others.

loans.name: Jannifer

texts.en:
Jannifer lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and owns a grocery stall, which she has been operating for three years. In this business, Jannifer now sells greens, fruits, vegetables, etc. Jannifer has two school-going children.
Jannifer learned about Milango through a friend. She aims to access credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuations and inflation, challenges purchasing stock, and a seasonal business climate.
Jannifer is applying for a loan of 41900 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and tomatoes wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also to open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables and tomatoes for her grocery stall.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has six children, five of whom are in school. She owns a water stall. The business has been operating for one year. Margret started the business with her personal savings. The family receives some income from the husband’s salary.
Margret learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are pipe breakages.
Margret is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to repair the water pipes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her repay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to repair the pipes in her water stall.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two school-going children. She owns a retail shop for selling unrefined brown sugar. The business has been operating for four years. Rose started the business with her personal savings. 
Rose learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.
Rose is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy stock of unrefined brown sugar for resale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy unrefined brown sugar for resale.

loans.name: Johana

texts.es: Johana vive en el pueblo costeño de Puerto Colombia. Ella a sus 27 años, tiene 5 hijos en  las edades de 1 y 11 años. Su negocio es la venta de mercancía por catálogo; todos los días se la pasa vendiendo perfumes, colonias, cremas corporales, cosméticos y otros productos a vecinos, amigos y familiares. Sus clientes piden un producto, y después ella compra el producto del catálogo para darlo a su cliente mediante un crédito corto. Johana empezó trabajando en este tipo de negocio por una amiga – ella ayudó a su amiga a vender productos, y hace un año decidió empezar a vender de manera independiente y afiliada a una empresa, con la que puede ofrecer lo que comercializa, mediante guías especializadas de productos, donde hay mucha opciones de encontrarlos con descuentos especiales y esto gusta mucho a su clientela.  Johana está aplicando a  un préstamo de Kiva, primer financiamiento que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que   invertirá en la compra de mas mercancías por catalogo para sus clientes. Ella espera que esta inversión la ayude a aumentar las ventas y las utilidades de su negocio. Sus metas familiares incluyen la mejora de su vivienda, donde vive con sus 5 hijos y cónyuge y por eso se esmera trabajando.
texts.en:
Johana lives in the coastal town of Puerto Colombia. She is 27 and has 5 children added from 1 to 11. Her business is selling catalog goods: she spends every day selling perfumes, colognes, body creams, cosmetics and other products to her neighbors, friends and family.

Her customers order a product, Johana then buys the product from the catalog to give it to her customer through a short-term credit. Johana started working in this type of business for her friend, helping her friend to sell products. One year ago she decided to start selling in an independent manner and be affiliated to a company with which she could offer what she sells through specialist product guides where there are many options to give them special discounts and her customers very much like this option.  
Johana is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in the purchase of more goods from catalogs for her customers. She hopes that this investment will help her to increase her business' sales and profits. 

Her goals for her family include improving her home where she lives with her five children and her partner, and that is why she strives to do her best when she works.

loans.use: to buy goods through catalogs for her customers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is married and runs a grocery stall, which has been operating for more than ten years. Besides this, Beatrice is a farmer, and she also sells clothes.
Beatrice sold some of her farm produce to obtain capital for the current business. She joined Milango to access credit for further business expansion. She is applying for a loan of 53,800 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stocks of food, such as tomatoes and potatoes, for resale. 
Beatrice’s future ambition is to own a cosmetics shop. The challenges she needs to overcome are high cost of transportation and the low seasons.

loans.use: to purchase additional food, such as tomatoes and potatoes, for her grocery stall.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a resident of Malindi, Coast Province, Kenya. She is a mother of two children; only one attends school. Asha runs a food cafe, a business that she has been operating for fourteen years. She sells rice, beans, potatoes, etc. Besides this, the family receives some income from the husband’s employment.
She learned about Milango through an employee and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are that some customers do not pay on time, and a seasonal business climate.
Asha is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenya shillings to purchase some flour, sugar, cereals, cooking oil and other items for the cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her standard of living. She aspires to open a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cereals, cooking oil, etc., for her cafe.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a resident of the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a charcoal business which has been in operation for the last three years. Apart from this business, she earns a salary from a food supply business.

Lilian learnt about Milango through a friend and joined the organization with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is lack of funds. 

She is applying for a loan of 62,700 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal and repair the store. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of her family. She aspires to be a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal and repair the store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a video cafe, a business he has been operating for one year now, selling compact discs. He is also a tailor.

He learnt about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are finding customers, fuel prices and purchasing stock.

Daniel is applying for a loan of 26,250 Kenya shillings to buy more compact discs, cables, extensions, etc. His extra income will be added to his savings to start a poultry farm. He aspires to own other video shops in other places.

loans.use: To buy more compact discs, cables, extensions, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a resident of the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is single and operates a cyber café, a business that she has been operating for four years. Apart from this she also runs a mobile money transfer shop and a posho mill.

She learnt about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are the seasonal business climate and bad debts.

Mary is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy a computer. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her income and improve the living standards of her life. She aspires to open other branches in the future and to own a computer college.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is a 31-year-old single mother with two children, a boy and a girl. She is a hairdresser and has been doing this job for 6 years now. 

This is her first loan with ID-Ghana and she is requesting an amount of 300 Ghana cedis to be able to buy shampoo, hair conditioner, rollers and hair creams. 

Her profit cannot sustain the business since she uses her profits to care for the children, so she needs a loan to buy more and earn more to be sustainable.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair conditioner, rollers and hair creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal and repair the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy braids, sprays, relaxers and a blow dry machine.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school-going children and owns a greengrocery stall which she has been operating for three years. In this business, Salama sells greens, fruits and vegetables, etc. She is also employed as an office secretary in an accounting firm.

Salama learnt about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock and the seasonal business climate.

She is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables wholesale and tomatoes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel lives in the Coastal town of Malindi. He runs a battery charging business which has been in operation for three years. He joined Milango in June this year. Since he also repairs batteries, he has decided to apply for a loan of Ksh 41,850 in order to purchase battery repair raw materials. The income from this loan will help Daniel provide for his family's needs. He looks forward to being a new battery dealer in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase battery repair raw materials.

loans.name: Mzalendo

texts.en:
Mzalendo lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a single businessman and sells groundnuts. It’s a business he has been running for two years. 

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations.

He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy a new stock of groundnuts. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to help him pay the loan. His future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy a new stock of groundnuts.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Loans from VisionFund Albania to the Roma/Egyptian vulnerable ethnic minority community in Albania have helped to improve their lives and businesses. 

Amongst the people who have benefited from VFA are Hasan, Irma, and their little son, who are photographed here. Hasan is 50 years old and Irma a bit younger and they recently got married. The family's main source of income comes from Hasan, who sells used clothes in four little towns in northern Albania and works very hard, going from one place to another.

The money he generates is enough to live, yet not enough to pay upfront for stocking up on fall/winter used inventory items to resell. Hasan is being respected by almost anyone who has known him and they comment on his good nature and responsible trait.

loans.use: to purchase fall/winter used clothes he wants to resell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 59 years old and lives in Maikay,Tudela. She is widowed without children. 

Rosita has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for seven years. Rosita requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
This is Elvera. She previously accessed a 22,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan for 50,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elvera dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Juana Nazaria

texts.es:
La señora Juana Nazaria es casada, tienen 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos, ninguno de ellos estudia, se dedica a la tejeduría, inició este negocio haciendo tricotado de hilo y hasta el momento lleva 3 años tejiendo, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo.

solicita un préstamo que lo9 utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, espera en el futuro contar con 3 telas y mejorar su capital y condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana Nazaria, 54, is married.  She didn't have the opportunity to go to school.  She has five children, none of whom is in school.  She makes a living as a weaver.  She started this business knitting, and has been a weaver for three years.  She has the support of her husband, who also is a weaver.

She's requesting a loan to buy different types and colors of thread.

In the future, she hopes to have fabric and to improve her capital and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toys and baby items such as playards, baby walkers, baby carriages, clothing, footwear, bottles, and more.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mirian Floricelda

texts.es: Miriam tiene 31 años de edad, estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hijo.  Ella Comenzó  a vender pocos  víveres ella vendía cola, arroz, aceite  para luego formar una  tienda de víveres en su casa pues eso es lo que ahora es su sustento de vida para Ella y su familia. Desde las 7:00am abre su negocio .Ella anhela que su negocio crezca más y poderlo surtir con mas productos. Pues con el préstamo el comprara mas víveres como .arroz, azúcar, aceite y mejorar su vivienda y su tienda etc.
texts.en: Miriam is 31 years old, single, and has one son. She began by selling a little food. She sold cola, rice, and oil, to later on create a grocery store in her home. That, then, is now the means of support for her and her family. From 7:00 a.m. her business is open. She longs for her business to grow more and to be able to supply it with more products. Then, with the loan, she will buy more food like rice, sugar, and oil, and improve her home and her store, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and improve her home and her store, etc.

loans.name: Eduvigues

texts.es:
Eduvigues, una mujer de 39, trabaja en la vente de cervezas y hielo en su comunidad costera, el barrio de La Playa que está en los alrededores de Barranquilla.
