La Playa es un sector turístico porque está en la orilla de La Ciénaga de Mayorquin, una laguna costera, donde llegan muchas personas los fines de semana a bañarse, a comer, pescar y tomar. Por eso, Eduvigues aprovechó de esta oportunidad e inició un negocio de venta de cerveza. Antes, ella tenía un lugar fijo para vender almuerzos y cervezas, pero los dueños de su punto de venta la desalojaron porque quería usar el lugar ellos mismos. Ella seguía vendiendo cerveza y hielo desde su casa, no solo a los turistas y visitantes sino a algunos vecinos también. Tiene 15 años de experiencia en este negocio, trabajando todos los fines de semana desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. 
Ahora, Eduvigues está aplicando a un préstamo de Kiva, su primer préstamo con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Va a invertir el crédito en la compra de cerveza, porque ahora ella tiene que comprar desde intermediarios, y le sale más costoso el producto. Ella quiere poder comprar directo en cantidades mayores para bajar sus costos. También, quiere comprar un enfriador para almacenar la cerveza. Ella espera que este crédito le ayude a aumentar sus ingresos productos del negocio; ella tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 14 años y una hija de 12 años, y quiere ganar mas,   para que ellos puedan seguir adelante con los estudios. Eduvigues y su esposo, por la falta de recursos, no pudieron estudiar, y ellos quieren que sus hijos tengan más oportunidades teniendo una educación de mucha calidad.
texts.en:
Eduvigues, a 39-year-old woman, works in the sale of beer and ice in her coastal community, the neighborhood of La Playa which is in the outskirts of Barranquilla. La Playa is a tourism sector because it is on the shore of La Ciénaga de Mallorquín, a coastal lagoon, where many people come on weekends to bathe, eat, fish, and drink. Therefore, Eduvigues took advantage of this opportunity and started a business selling beer. Before, she had a permanent place to sell lunch and beer, but the owners of her store evicted her because they wanted to use the place themselves. She continued to sell beer and ice from her home, not only to tourists and visitors but also to some neighbors. She has 15 years of experience in this business, working every weekend from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m.

Now, Eduvigues is applying for a loan from Kiva, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She is going to invest the loan in buying beer, because now she has to buy from intermediaries and the product becomes more expensive. She wants to be able to buy direct in larger quantities to lower her expenses. Also, she wants to buy a cooler to store the beer. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her revenue and products in the store; she has two sons who are 13 and 14 years of age and one 12-year-old daughter, and she wants to make more money so that they can continue with their studies. Eduvigues and her husband, due to lack of resources, were not able to study, and they want their children to have more opportunities by having a high-quality education.

loans.use: to buy beer and a cooler to store it.

loans.name: Oneida

texts.es: Oneida invirtió su crédikiva anterior en la compra de perfumes, cremas, cosméticas, ropa, calzado e implementos para el hogar y los vendió a los clientes de su negocio de mercancía que los compraron mediante sus guías especializadas o catálogos. Ella pudo vender todo lo que compró con su crédito anterior, y entusiasmada, ahora está aplicando a un nuevo crédito, con el cual   comprará el mismo tipo de productos – perfumes, cosméticas, ropa, etc.  La segunda parte del año es la temporada que tiene el pico de ventas más alto, para este tipo de negocios. Ella tiene su clientela fija y es muy buena vecina, lo que le permite aumentar sus clientes referidos. Oneida quiere decir lo siguiente a sus fondeadores: “Muchas agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Espero seguir recibiendo su apoyo económico para continuar ampliando mi empresa.”
texts.en:
Oneida invested her previous Kiva loan in buying perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothing, footwear, and household items, and sold them to her customers who bought the merchandise through her specialized guides and catalogues.  She managed to sell everything she bought with her previous loan so, enthusiastic, now she's requesting another loan to buy the same type of products--perfume, cosmetics, clothing, etc.

The second part of the year is the season with peak sales for this type of business.  She has her steady customers and is a very good neighbor, which allows her to increase her referred customers.

Oneida wants to say the following to her funders: "Many thanks to Kiva and to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  I hope to continue getting your financial support to continue expanding my business."

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilaria; la socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de productos secos como kinua y tarwi,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia compra su mercaderia en el distrito de Pisaq para luego venderlos en las ferias de uno de los mercados del Cusco,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderia al por mayor como tarwi.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member, Hilaria, belongs to Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata Communal Bank, located in the community of Yuncaypata in the province and department of Cusco.  Hilaria continues with her business buying and selling dried goods such as quinoa and tarwi beans.

She has been in this business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She buys her merchandise in the district of Pisaq and later sells it in the street markets in one of the markets in Cusco.  She's a responsible and hardworking person, this being the way she gets her family ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy merchandise wholesale, such as tarwi beans.

She's happy about the loan and pledges to make the payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy tarwi beans wholesale

loans.name: Leide

texts.es: Leide tiene una tienda donde vende rancho, víveres y licores. Ella también distribuye  bollos, un amasijo de maíz, envuelto en el capacho del maíz al que agregan queso y chichas de maíz. Ella tiene 15 años de experiencia con este negocio, lo empezó para dar respuesta a sus ingresos los que empleada no consiguió, por falta de oportunidades laborales para ella,  en Barranquilla, donde ella vive con su cónyuge y 3 hijos de 6, 10 y 16 años. Ella vende sus productos directamente a los consumidores finales, que son en vecinos del sector y referídos por estos. Leide pide un préstamo de Kiva para la compra de productos de consumo masivo como ranchos y víveres, y para producir chichas de arroz. También quiere comprar licores e insumos que tienen mucha rentabilidad para su negocio.  Leide espera que el préstamo la ayude en el crecimiento de su negocio, para llegar a tener un autoservicio, con el que pueda ganar más ingresos. Leide también quiere mucho que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, y por eso trabaja todos los días, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, generando ingresos que necesita sean suficientes para que su familia viva más cómoda.
texts.en:
Leide has a store where she sells food, provisions, and liquor.  She also distributes ‘bollos’, a piece of corn dough wrapped in corn husks to which cheese is added, and ‘chichas de maíz’ [corn based drink].

She has 15 years of experience in this business.  She started it to answer her need for income because she could not find employment.  This is because there is a lack of work opportunities in Barranquilla, where she lives with her husband and three children, ages 6, 10, and 16.

She sells her products directly to the final consumers, which are her neighbors and people referred by them.  

Leide is requesting a Kiva loan to buy mass consumption products like food and supplies and to be able to make rice chichas.  She also wants to buy liquor and provisions that are very profitable for her business.

Leide hopes that the loan will help her with the growth of her business.  She wants to have a self-service with which she would be able to get more income.  Leide also really wants her children to complete their studies.  That is why she works every day from seven in the morning until nine at night generating the income needed so that her family lives more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy mass consumption products like food and supplies and to be able to make rice chichas.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 64 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has four children.

To earn a living, Deborah has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Deborah has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending  business.

Deborah has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is 50 years of age. She is a hardworking woman. She is married and is a loving mother of four children. 

She operates sari-sari store business to support her family, earning PHP 500 every day. Blanca’s income is insufficient due to the high cost of commodities and electricity. So she therefore determined to ask for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional groceries such as biscuits, canned goods, noodles and coffee. With the loan, she hopes to increase her proceeds every day in order to be able to meet her expenses and to save for continued education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries such as biscuits, canned goods, noodles and coffee.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married and has four children. 

She buys and sells fruits and vegetables. She is trying to learn the trade despite the poor living they are experiencing. 

She feels so hurt seeing her children’s suffering from poor living. She wants to achieve greater income in order to give them a good life, so she is asking assistance of the lenders through ASKI with a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase different kinds of fruits and vegetables. 

She hopes through these investments she can prepare a better living for her children and operate her business prosperously.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
This is Julia. She previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Julia hopes to have a good life and that her business will grow and expand through all her hard work on it. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Emelio

texts.en:
Emelio previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business budgets. 

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, resulting in increased profit which will definitely help him to meet his family's needs and children's educational expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Emelio hopes that his business will expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to  also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn, 28, lives in Pantaon, Ozamiz City. She is married and has one son. 
To earn a living, Cerelyn runs a business selling canned goods, rice, detergents, noodles, etc. She earns about PHP 40,000 each month from her store. Cerelyn requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more items including cartons of mosquito killer, detergent, powder soft, beverages and sacks of rice.
Cerelyn has been a member of PMPC for seven months. In the future, Cerelyn would like to expand her business .

loans.use: to purchase cartons of mosquito killer, detergent, powder soft, beverages, sacks of rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 48 years old and lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has four children.

To earn a living, Francisca has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.

Francisca has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Francisca has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Francisca would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en: Nelfa is 63 years old and lives at Catadman, Ozamiz City. Nelfa is married with two children. To earn a living, Nelfa is a cook for MBD Construction and she has a monthly pension. Nelfa has been doing this type of work for almost 30 years .She has requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase materials for house repair. Nelfa hopes to improve her family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house repair.

loans.name: Conchita Group

texts.en: Conchita is the leader of her group. She is 67 years of age and lives in Malaubanfor. She seeks additional capital for her business as a fish vendor . Conchita has been a member of PMPC - Ozamiz Branch for almost three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase fish for additional sales. Conchita hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for additional sales.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 45 years of age and lives at Labo, Ozamiz City. She has five children. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP for her house repair. Carmelita has been a member of PMPC - Ozamiz Branch for almost five years. She hopes that our cooperative can improve her living conditions in even a little way.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house repair

loans.name: Mariketa

texts.en:
Mariketa, 62, is married with two children and lives in Unidos, Plaridel Misamis Occidental.
Mariketa sells variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan to purchase  flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.
Mariketa has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Mariketa hopes to have more savings to build capital.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estefanía; la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva años en esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia siembra lo que son papa, cebada entre otros para luego venderlo en las ferias sabatinas en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Estefania belongs to the communal bank “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”. The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata, belonging to the Cusco province and department.

Estefania continues to make a living through agriculture. She has spent years in this business, which is doing well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business each day. She plants potatoes and barley, among others, to later sell in the Saturday markets, in one of the markets of the city of Cusco. Estefania is a responsible and hard-working person, and in this way that helps her family to come out ahead.

Estefania is applying for the loan to buy fertilizers and soil nutrient additives for her small farm.

Estefania is glad for the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and soil nutrient additive for her small farm.

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita is married and has been blessed with two children. Her husband is a salesman at an auto supply company.

Normalita has operated a piggery for two years. She raises six hogs for sale. Aside from this, Normalita also offers vegetable and owns a retail store. She and her husband work hard to continually provide income for their family's daily expenses.

Normalita would like to take out for a loan of PHP 40,000, allowing her to buy livestock feed, vaccines and vitamins for her hogs. She knows that through providing necessary nutrition to her hogs, she can keep them healthy and enable them to reach their optimum growth. In addition, she can get a better price, which will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and send her two children into higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed, vaccines and vitamins of her raised hogs.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora  is 59 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has five children.

Dioscora has a dress shop business and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase material for use in her dress shop business.

Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Dioscora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase material for use in her dress shop business.

loans.name: Tolentina

texts.en:
Tolentina is married and has six children. Tolentina is 51 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Tolentina raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase piglets and feeds.

Tolentina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Tolentina hopes to expand her piggery.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, 60, is a widower with five children and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 
Felix works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 25 years. He has requested a loan of 15000 PHP to purchase a fishing net. 
Felix has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Felix hopes to have savings for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food supplies and also more goods such as sheets, pillow covers, bedspreads and more

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is widowed with six children. She is 54 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Teresita is a farmer who grows vegetable crops to earn a living. Teresita has been doing this for three years. Teresita has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional fertilizers.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve their general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 54 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin. She is married with four children. To earn a living, Mila has a business selling barbecue in her community. She earns about 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work.

Mila has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as oil, barbecue sauce, etc. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 months. In the future, Mila would like to save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as oil, barbecue sauce, etc.

loans.name: Kantuta De Collana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS DE COLLANA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra y venta de repuestos, compra y venta de cerveza, producción de papa, compra y venta de ganado, venta de papa, venta de piedra caliza, producción de alfombras, venta de chuño y ganado, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que participa Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio; cuenta que hace años inicio este negocio por recomendación de su suegra.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza) que adquirirá de la empresa distribuidora y posteriormente lo venderá en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de salud.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora Justina, quien tuvo que marcharse por razones de trabajo.
texts.en:
The A.C. “Kantutas de Collana” will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. It is made up of nine members and is headed by a board of directors where Juana is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry out are varied. Among them are: the purchase and sale of spare parts, the purchase and sale of beer, the production of potatoes, the purchase and sale of livestock, the sale of potatoes, the sale of limestone, the production of carpets, the sale of potato flour and livestock, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they will be taking out will benefit small micro-businesswomen where Juana is a member. She says that it is the first time that Pro Mujer has participated, joining through the invitation of a promoter of the institution who went to visit her at her home. Currently, she has a neighborhood store; she says that years ago she started this business because of the recommendation of her mother-in-law.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (purchase of beer) that she will obtain from the distributing company and subsequently sell in her commercial space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family in every way possible; she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health training.

In the photograph, Justina is not present, since she had to leave because of work.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil divorciada, tiene 2 hijos .Ella comenzó de a raíz de la separación de su ex esposo. Empezó de a poquita mercadería  pero ahora tiene un local de venta de ropa, por lo que  ella quiere es contratar más empleados para su negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y brindarle trabajo a personas que no tenga. Con el préstamo comprara mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, blusas
texts.en:
The borrower is 37 years old and single. She is divorced and has two children. She started as a result of the separation from her ex-husband. 

She started off with a very small amount of merchandise, and now has a clothing stand. Therefore she wants to hire more employees for her business. 

Her dream is to expand her business and offer work to people who don't have it. With the loan, she will buy merchandise such as pants, skirts and blouses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as pants, skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 53 years old – a very industrious mom and wife. With her strategic mind and good budgeting style, she is able to send her five children to school. The only business she has is selling snacks in the school canteen, but she has promoted her children’s educational needs. As she says, the income she generates from her business is carefully utilized in order to continue to prosper. 

Now, to develop more income, she is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos to buy snack foods, noodles, soft drinks and other basic materials for cooking sweets such as sugar and milk. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, noodles, soft drinks and other basic materials for cooking sweets such as sugar and milk

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ligaya. She previously accessed a 24,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to buy additional inventory of clothes and processed meats. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Ligaya would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional inventory of clothes and processed meats. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ligaya wants to improve her business and be more successful. She wants to extend help to her grandchildren who are now studying. Ligaya hopes that all of them will finish their studies. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to believe more in God’s love for mankind. The Bible sharing allows her to learn more about the life of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional inventory of clothes and processed meats.

loans.name: Sheila Joy

texts.en:
Sheila Joy is 38 years old. She married to Hector who is a police officer. They have two school-age children. 

Sheila Joy has beauty parlor that she has been operating for five and a half years. She says that she started this small business because she wanted to find a way to help her husband with the household expenditures and to improve their poor economic situation in order to enjoy a good quality of life. 

To help out more, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy new scissors, a blower, hair color and pay for the labor cost of her one companion in beautifying customers. She hopes to earn higher income this time in order to hire more-and help-other people who have the talent.

loans.use: to buy new scissors, a blower, hair color, to and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional inventory of clothes and other merchandise for resale. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional inventory of clothes and other merchandise. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

In the coming years, Susan dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education and hopes to give them a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing and other merchandise for resale

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is married and had three children. She manages a small hog raising business in which she generates PHP 3,000 for each hog sold. She would like to improve her income and Leonita needed PHP 8,000 to buy medicines and feed for the hogs’ maintenance. 

Someday, Leonita would like to keep growing as a successful hog raiser and build a healthy lifestyle, too.

loans.use: to buy medicines and feed for her hogs' maintenance.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hog raiser at Lanna. She is married, had three children, and she is now 52 years old. She has been in her business for almost seven years. She gains PHP 4,000 for each hog disposed to butchers. 

She is now borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs’ sustenance. Proper maintenance of the raised animals will lead her to sell them at higher cost. 

With good profits from her small business, she will keep providing sustenance for the family and also achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustenance.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a loving mother. She is married and had eight children. Her youngest child still attends school, while the rest have settled into marriage and live separately from them. 

To acquire profits, she is raising hogs to fatten and breed and then re-sells them to butchers at the village where they live. She wanted to keep improving her business, so that is why she is availing a loan of PHP 12,000. She will buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines to ensure healthy hogs to raise. 

It will boost up her profits and someday she will achieve a more profitable business and likewise improve their living conditions as well.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines for sustainability.

loans.name: Eva Elena

texts.es: Eva invirtió su crédito anterior en la compra de accesorios, insumos para confecciones y papelería, para su negocio de Variedades, que es muy conocido en el barrio por gente que quiere comprar papelerías, insumos de confecciones, accesorios femeninos y más. Ella pudo ampliar su negocio y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes, y esto resultó en más ingresos para ella y su familia de 2 hijos jóvenes, con los que ella sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas. Por eso, ella quiere seguir aumentado su negocio con la ayuda de los créditos; hoy está aplicando a un nuevo crédito, para la compra de papelería, dulcerías, cosméticas, y accesorios para confecciones, pues es la segunda temporada del año donde las ventas usualmente se incrementan y ella va a aprovechar ésta coyuntura.. Tiene muchos años de experiencia en el negocio y tiene también muchos clientes leales. Eva quiere decir lo siguiente a sus fondeadores de Kiva: “Gracias por apoyarme con el crédito, el cual me dieron y fue de gran ayuda para mi negocio, espero que me continúen apoyando.”
texts.en:
Eva invested her previous loan in the purchase of accessories, clothing inputs and stationery, for her variety store which is very well-known in the neighborhood by people who want to buy stationery, apparel inputs, feminine accessories and more. She was able to expand her business and offer more products to her clients, and this resulted in more income for herself and her family of two young children, whom she dreams of converting into successful people.

For this reason, she wants to continue increasing her business with the help of the loans. Today she is applying for a new loan  for the purchase of stationery, candy, cosmetics, and clothing accessories since it is the second season of the year - in which sales usually increase - and she is going to take advantage of this occasion. She has many years of experience in the business and she also has many loyal clients. 

Eva wants to say the following to her Kiva donors: "Thank you or supporting me with the loan which they gave to me and was a great help for my business, I hope you continue supporting me."

loans.use: to purchase stationery, candy, cosmetics, and clothing accessories

loans.name: Jero

texts.en: Jero would like to continue her loan. She use the initial loan to purchase fertilizers and vegetables seeds (such as potato, tomato, cabbage, etc.). She maintains the land by her self. The weather is very good to plant the vegetables. She hopes the vegetables will grow faster and according to her plan, she can sell in three months from planting. All the benefits from this bussines are use to renovation her house.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer supplies.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise to sell in her business. Her earnings were a big for her children’s education and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and  on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Juanita fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma owns and manages a welding shop in her community which provides the financial resources to cope with her family's growing needs. Her husband is the one who is trained in this field, but she helps him through managing the business and providing good communication and friendly character to their customers. 

She is planning to expand their business but insufficient capital stops her from executing the plan. In order to fulfill her plans, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 for the expansion of the welding shop. She will then be able to support her husband in earning a higher income and saving for the education of their two children.

loans.use: to expand her welding shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan works hard to fulfill her simple dream of providing for the needs of her family. She is happily married to Winston, who works in their municipal office. The couple is blessed with five children. To help her husband with everyday expenditures, she runs her livestock business. At this time, she is raising two fattening hogs. She wants to provide a better way of life for her family. So, to obtain her objective, she is requesting financial support from lenders through ASKI in the amount of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase hog feed, medicine and vitamins for her livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, medicine and vitamins

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of liquor and other beverages. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of liquor and other beverages. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Violeta hopes her business will expand through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en: Renalyn operates a hog-fattening business as a source of income. After four to five months of caring, she can then dispose of her hogs for a profitable price. She earns a maximum of P 8,000 for each head. She is 40 years of age and has been devoting herself to this business for 11 years. Now, she is applying for additional working capital to develop her business. A loan of PHP 16,000 will be used to buy feed and vitamins. This will allow Renalyn to continue increasing her proceeds and enjoy a good way of living.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Petra

texts.en: Petra's business is raising hogs to fatten and breed. She had been doing this for over 10 years now. She is 55 years old and strong enough to still be engaged in a business. Petra is already widowed. She acquires about PHP 4,000 for each hog disposed. She was able to give allowances to her youngest child. She had eight children total, but the rest have settled into marriage. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 so she will make her business grow profitably. Petra will buy hog feed and vaccines for sustaining the hogs. In the future, Petra hopes to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur and somehow provide sustenance for their living.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy motorbike for motorbike rental business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of supplies and products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks supplies and products. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Vilma hopes her business will expand and grow through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rheza

texts.en:
Rheza is married with one child. She is 29 years old and lives in Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Rheza sells native wine to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to pay for labor for her native wine business.

Rheza has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for labor for her native wine business

location.town: Plaridel-Polo Pitogo, Bato, Plaridel, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. His profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy auto-rickshaw for rickshaw rental business

loans.name: Concepción Valerio

texts.es: Concepción usó su crédito anterior en la compra de un enfriador y en la adecuación de la cocina para implementar un restaurante en su casa. También compró implementos y víveres, para poder cocinar almuerzos y comidas rápidas. Ahora, él está aplicando a un nuevo crédito, para seguir comprando implementos de trabajo y víveres para la elaboración de sus comidas rápidas y almuerzos. Cuenta con una clientela permanente debido a su excelente ubicación – solamente esta buscando capital para poder proveer almuerzos y comidas a esta clientela. Concepción quiere decir lo siguiente a sus fondeadores de Kiva: “Ya he recibido 2 créditos con ustedes los cuales me he esmerado por pagar puntual. Espero que me continúen apoyando. Gracias a ustedes veo fortalecer mi negocio y mejorar mi nivel de vida.”
texts.en:
Concepción used his previous loan to buy a cooler and to adapt his kitchen to set up a restaurant in his house.  He also bought utensils and provisions to be able to cook lunches and fast food.

Now he's requesting a new loan to continue buying work utensils and provisions to make fast food and lunch.  He has regular customers because of his excellent location.  He's only looking for capital to be able to serve those customers lunch and meals.

Concepción wants to say the following to his Kiva funders: "I've already received two loans with you, which I've tried very hard to repay punctually.  I hope you continue to support me.  Thanks to you, I see my business getting stronger and my living conditions improving."

loans.use: to buy work utensils and provisions to make fast food and lunch

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
At her age of 45, Grace still generates income to meet her family's needs. She is married and has three children. She raise hogs to resell for profit. From the business, she makes 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for each hog sold. She has been doing this business for five years now and hopes to improve it. She is asking for 7,000 PHP to buy medicines and vaccines to sustain the hogs and enable them to grow healthier. 

Grace hopes to attain a progressive business to pay for her children's education and someday achieve a progressive life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines to sustain hogs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to cover her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marilyn hopes her business will expand and grow into a mini-grocery through all her hard work. She also hopes to give her child a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hog-raising is the primary source of income of Hilaria's family. She is 49 years old and is married with six children. Hilaria is willing to do everything to lift her family from poor living. Right now, Hilaria is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to buy hog-feed and vaccines for the proper growth of her hogs. She believes that through her loan, she can improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy hog-feed and vaccines for the proper growth of her hogs

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn is 54 years old. She is married and resides with two children in a rural area of Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has farmed rice on a five-hectare area of farmland for ten years and also planted beans on a two-hectare area of farmland. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day and allows her to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

This is the fifth microloan for Chanthorn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loans, which she completely paid back, have supported her family living conditions. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. Chanthorn will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as to improve her standard of living and fulfill her dream to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cultivated land

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 45 years old. She is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She hopes that someday, through her barbecue making business, she will able to send all their children to finish school. And to attain this dream, their business should promote and maintain its good condition. But Lilia hasn’t enough funds to purchase additional pork to make barbecue. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to use in purchase of pork and ingredients such as soy sauce, salt, oil, ketchup, garlic, vinegar and onion. She prays she will be able to maximize their income in order to save for their children’s education as well as build a better barbecue stand.

loans.use: to purchase pork and ingredients such as soy sauce, salt, oil, ketchup, garlic, vinegar and onions

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita is 62 years old, married and has six children. She raises hogs as a source of income. She has been in this business for over 20 years and it is a great help to her family's living situation. Despite her age, Julita wishes to care for more pigs, and raise healthy and meaty hogs in order to achieve greater income.  Now, she is requesting a loan of P8,000 to buy vitamins, feed and two more pigs. These would be a help in attaining good proceeds.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed and two more pigs

loans.name: Vannak's Group

texts.en:
Vannak is a 46-year-old rice farmer who lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Out of her three children, she still has one child (a son) to take care of and still in school. Besides farming, she has been grown cassava on a 5-hectare area of farmland for twenty-eight years. She earns about 30,000 KHR per day and manages to save almost 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Vannak has been with VisionFund for one cycle and fully paid back the past loan while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Vannak has wisely utilized the past loan to better support her family's living conditions. Now she and her group member are requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR respectively.Vannak is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs in plowing the field. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make a living better and keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna is 47 years old, married and has six children, four of whom are attending school. She has a small business raising and selling hogs to butchers. She has been doing this for eight years now. She usually makes 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) for each hog sold, and it goes for their meals and allowances for school.

To improve her sales, Benigna is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to ensure good nutrition for her hogs. She will buy hog feed and medicines. Someday, she hopes to become a successful hog raiser and further improve their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and medicines

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is 59 years old, married, and had seven children. She is selling fried and stewed peanuts as a source of income. Sometimes she walks door to door in order to sell easier. Now, Mercedes wishes to increase her sales every day. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more peanuts. Hopefully, through these additional funds, she will also earn additional profits.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy beads, thread, and a sewing machine for embroidery

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is married and has one child. She is 23 years old and has been raising hogs for two years. She is very proud that even though she didn’t finish her education, she is still able to earn and help her husband in their daily expenditures. 

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins. This could possibly expand her sales, which can help her save and achieve a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Amone

texts.pt:
Viúvo e pai de 5 filhos, alguns ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele.
Trabalha como segurança numa empresa privada. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, chapas de zinco, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com ampliação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua obra e oferecer melhor conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para poder investir no seu plano.
texts.en: Amone is a widow and the father of five children, some of whom are still in school.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his parents who live with him.  He works as a security guard at a private company.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, stone, zinc sheets, beams, etc.) to continue expanding his home.  In the future, he hopes to finish his home to offer better comfort to his family.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is the lack of sufficient funds to invest in his plan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, stone, zinc sheets, beams, etc.) to continue expanding his home.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a very young woman who is married to Erwin who is also a farming man. They have three school-aged children. In order to supply the needs of her family, she is asking for a loan of Php 18,000 to buy sacks of fertilizer and seed to grow. Farming is the only way they earn their living. Myrna hopes that she can build their own house so that she can give a good quality of life to her family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and seed to grow for her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos, que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como empacotadora numa empresa privada. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, chapas de zinco, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com ampliação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja aumentar mais um quarto e varanda para oferecer mais conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar ainda mais para garantir o pagamento do seu empréstimo.
texts.en: Ana is married and is the mother of three children, who go to school.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.  She works as a baler in a private company.  She will use this loan to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, zinc sheets, beams, etc.) to continue work expanding her home.  In the future, she hopes to expand it more by adding a room and a porch to offer more comfort to her family.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is working even more to guarantee the payment of her loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, zinc sheets, beams, etc.) to continue expanding her home.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is engaged in buying and selling bottles in the village. She has been in this business for almost 2 years and she usually receives P150 a day from it. Lucita wants to buy more bottles to clean in order to increase her sales daily. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more bottles. She hopes that as time passes, she can earn more and save to be able to also purchase  plastics which cost a higher price.

loans.use: to buy more bottles

loans.name: Mariecar

texts.en: Mariecar is a very diligent and hardworking young woman. She makes sure that she can provide for all the needs of her family. She is 23 years old and married to Freddie. They help each other to cover the needs of their new life as a married couple. For that reason, Mariecar is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and seeds to grow in her farming business. She hopes that her business will expand so that she provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, and seeds to grow in her farming business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married with 12 children. She is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Esterlita is a farmer and grows  rice  to earn a living. She has been doing this for 40  years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide.

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to have a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Romao

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como agente de serviço numa empresa privada. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, areia, cimento, pedra, chapas de zinco, barrotes e outros) para ampliar a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja comprar mobília para apetrechar a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é aumentar a sua receita trabalhando ainda mais com a sua esposa.
texts.en: Romao is married and is the father of three children who go to school.  He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone besides his family.  He works at a private company.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (iron, sand, cement, stone, zinc sheets, beams, etc.) to expand his home.  In the future, he hopes to buy furniture to fix up his house.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  He challenge is increasing his income even more with his wife.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (iron, sand, cement, stone, zinc sheets, beams, etc.) to expand his home.

loans.name: Gervasio

texts.pt:
Solteiro sem filhos ainda, vive na casa dos seus pais e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como agente de serviço. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, pedra, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja continuar com os seus estudos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos para fazer o nível superior.
texts.en: Gervasio is single and doesn't have any children.  He lives in his parents' home and doesn't support anyone.  He is employed.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, beams, etc.) to continue construction on his home.  In the future, he hopes to continue with his studies.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is the lack of funds to get higher education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, cement, stone, beams, etc.) to continue construction on his home.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho ainda menor de idade, vive na casa dos seus pais e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (portas, areia, cimento, pedra, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja incorporar-se como segurança, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e realizar mais empréstimos para responder aos seus planos.
texts.en: Rosa is a single mother of one young son.  She lives in her parents' home and doesn't support anyone else.  She has her own business selling various products.  She will use this loan to buy construction materials (doors, sand, cement, stone, beams, etc.) to continue construction on her home.  In the future, she hopes to become licensed in insurance.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is working more and completing more loans to carry out her plans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (doors, sand, cement, stone, beams, etc.) to continue construction on her home.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.pt:
Viúva mãe de 6 filhos já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria com seus filhos e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de frangos e ovos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar mais frangos e ovos para revenda. 
No futuro deseja comprar electrodomésticos para confortar ainda mais a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e realizar mais empréstimos para responder aos seus planos.
texts.en: Olinda is a widow and the mother of six children, who are now adults.  She lives in her own home with her children and doesn't support anyone else.  She has her own business selling chickens and eggs.  She will use this loan to buy more chickens and eggs to resell.  In the future, she hopes to buy appliances to offer more comfort to her family.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is working more and completing more loans so she can carry out her plans.

loans.use: to buy and sell chickens.

loans.name: Anastancia

texts.pt:
Solteira sem filhos ainda, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (açúcar, óleo, feijão, massas, farinha e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja construir uma mercearia e fazer um murro de vedação, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ampliar cada vez mais o seu negócio.
texts.en: Anastancia is single and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her own home and doesn't support anyone else.  She has a business selling various products.  She will use this loan to buy products (sugar, oil, beans, dough, flour, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to build a grocery store and to build a wall for security.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is expanding her business more and more.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (sugar, oil, beans, dough, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 51 years old and raises hogs as a source of income. She has two children who already have their own family. Now, she needs to work for herself and her husband. She has been in this business for more than eight years. With this duration of working in this business, Edna still hopes for better. Everyone wishes for a better living, and Edna really pursues her dream to have a better lifestyle. To totally overcome poverty, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy feed and vitamins. It will provide her additional proceeds soon.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lydia hopes that her business will grow and expand through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is married with two children. Leslie is 25 years old and lives in Liposong, Ozamis City. He operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to earn a living. He has been doing this for 6 years, and every month he earns 6,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to repair his existing vehicle to provide a better service. 

In 2010, Leslie joined GDMPC. In the future, Leslie hopes for his children to finish their studies, and he hopes he will gain double the income out of his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Chadrec

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos dos quais já vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda produtos diversos. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (portas, areia cimento, ferro, arames e outros) para dar continuidade com a ampliação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja solicitar empréstimo para comprar mobília da sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é conclusão da ampliação da sua casa e adquirir novo mobiliário.
texts.en: Chadrec is married and is the father of four children, two of whom go to school.  He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone else.  He has his own business selling various products.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (doors, sand, cement, iron, wires, etc.) to continue work expanding his home.  In the future, he hopes to request more loans to buy furniture for his home.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time.  His challenge is finishing his home and acquiring new furniture.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (doors, sand, cement, iron, wires, etc.) to continue expanding his home.

loans.name: Conseta

texts.en:
Conseta, a retail store owner, is very thankful for her business. She is married and has four children. Her income from the business serves as their sustenance for daily meals and daily allowances too. She runs her store from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily. She has been selling grocery items for 10 years now. She is asking for this loan to have additional capital to buy eggs, sardines, noodles, soap, shampoo and detergent to add to her merchandise in the store. She is asking for 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) and promises to pay it back in full. 

In the future, with good revenue from her business, she will be able to save funds for use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sardines, noodles, soap, shampoo and detergent to sell in her store

loans.name: Matea

texts.en: Matea, 47 years old, is a widow who raises and sells chickens for profit. She has been doing this for five years now. Matea has four children. Now she has insufficient funds to ensure a profitable business. She needs to buy feed and medicines to sustain her chickens, so they will grow healthier and can be sold for a higher price. She is borrowing 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She would like to keep improving sales and ensure a good future for all her children too.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and medicines

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is involved in buying and selling hog-feed in the village of Guayabal. She has been in this business for three years now. She has been earning a net income of PHP 4,500 a week. Right now, Jenny is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and other materials needed in the hog-raising business. She believes that this loan will help her to carry out her plan, and she hopes to be successful.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and other materials needed in the hog-raising business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
This is Edwin. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in his business. His profits from the business will definitely help him to cover his daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Edwin hopes to grow his business in the coming years, just as he hopes to support his children's schooling up to the college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients for his food stall.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El Comité lleva por nombre Kuña Aty, que significa reunión de mujeres, ya que eso hicieron las 14 mujeres que forman parte del comité, ya que se unieron para salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Actualmente se encuentra en el Tercer ciclo, y tratan siempre de superar cualquier desafío que se les presenta.
Juana una de las miembros del grupo, tiene una despensita bien surtida con todos los artículos de primera necesidad que necesitan sus vecinos, y es gracias a su pequeño negocio que ayuda su familia. Juana es el sostén de su familia y es por ellos que siempre lucha.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de fideos, arroz, yerba, azúcar y demás, para que de esa forma pueda seguir dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
This committee is named “Kuña Aty”, which means “Gathering of Women”. The group consists of 14 women who belong to the committee. They meet in order to move forward and help one another. The members are currently in their third loan cycle and always try to overcome any challenge that comes before them.

Juana is one of the members of the group. She has a small food pantry that is well-stocked with all types of basic necessities that her neighbors need. Thanks to her small business, Juana has been able to help her family. She is the breadwinner in her family, so she always gives her best effort. Juana is requesting a loan in order to buy noodles, rice, herbs, sugar, and other products so that she can continue offering her customers what they need.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, herbs, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Adriana tiene la edad de 54 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 están a su cargo. Su hija cursa el 5to año de Biología y su hijo cursa el 3er año de la carrera de Derecho. 

Doña Adriana labora para una institución gubernamental desde hace 14 años. Ella es una persona emprendedora, alegre, con deseos de superación al igual que su familia.

 este crédito que esta solicitando lo invertira en pago de tramite de titulo universitario de  su hija, con los créditos anteriores  que ha recibido le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que a realizado algunas mejoras en su casa de habitación.

agradece a KIVA y CEPRODEL por el apoyo que le puedan brindar, para cumplir su sueño de  lograr preparar a sus hijos con un educación superior.
texts.en:
Adriana is 54 years old, is married and has three children, of whom two depend on her. Her daughter attends 5th year of Biology and his son attends his 3rd year of Law. Adriana works for a governmental institution for 14 years. She is an entrepreneur, happy, with a desire to excel for her and her family. 

This loan she is requesting will be invested in paying her daughter's college certificate. The previous loans she received have been of great help, because she has made some improvements in her home. She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they can offer to realize her dream of preparing her children for higher education.

loans.use: to pay for college expenses (certificate).

loans.name: Sucena

texts.es:
La señora Sucena tiene 47 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su esposo quien la respalda en su negocio propio lo que es alquiler de apartamentos, Ella este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 20 años. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto muy céntrico, ya que esta en uno de los barrios cercanos al centro de la cuidad y esto hace que tenga bastante demanda, por muchas personas.
Doña Sucena el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: cemento, pintura, lija, canaleta, laminas, barrilla etc. el impacto esperado con el crédito, es remodelar sus apartamentos, de esta manera darles un servicio de calidad a cada uno de sus clientes.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Sucena es seguir creciendo en su negocio, como también construir varios apartamentos, y de esta manera generarse buenos ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Choluteca Honduras - Septiembre del 2012.
texts.en:
Sucena is 47 years old and lives in the south of Honduras with her husband. They have had an apartment rental business for the past 20 years.  Her business is located in a very central area of the city, in a neighborhood that is close to the downtown. Because of this, there is a significant demand for her apartments. 

Sucena needs the loan to purchase cement, paint, sandpaper, ducts, roofing sheets, steel rods, amongst other materials. The expected impact of the loan will be the renovation of her apartments, so that she can give a quality service to each of her customers. Susena’s plans for the future include continuing to make her business grow by building several apartments, so that she can get good income and improve her quality of life. 

Choluteca Honduras- September 2012.

loans.use: to purchase cement, paint, sandpaper, ducts, roofing sheets and steel rods  for her business.

loans.name: Concepcion Socorro

texts.es: Concepción del socorro de 60 anos de edad madre soltera con tres hijos mayores de edad de 33,26.19 anos de los cuales el menor esta bajo su responsabilidad, esta estudiando en la Universidad,  y es una de las razones que la motiva para seguir adelante y seguir luchando en la vida para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos. Concepción tiene por actividad económica la venta de prendas de plata, y oro el cual distribuye de forma ambulante y por encargo a sus clientes fijos y eventuales. La rutina de concepción es salir a las calle a ofrecer su mercadería en horas temprano, hasta el atardecer. Producto que ofrece de crédito y contado, recuperando quincenalmente. Concepción ha demostrado su responsabilidad en créditos anteriores   y ha efectuado sus pagos en tiempo y forma. En la actualidad esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con  prendas nuevas para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Concepción del Socorro is a 60 year-old single mother with three children, ages 33, 26 and 19 years old. She is still responsible for the youngest, who is studying at the University and is one of the reasons she is motivated to keep moving forward and to keep fighting to offer a better future to her children. Concepción works selling pieces of silver and gold jewelery, which she sells in an itinerant manner and on orders from her regular and occasional customers. Concepción's routine is to go out in the street to offer her merchandise from an early hour until the late afternoon. She offers her products for cash or on credit, which she collects on every 15 days. Concepción has demonstrated her responsibility with previous loans and has made those repayments on time. She is currently requesting financing to invest in working capital and to stock her business with new pieces to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to stock her jewelery business with gold and silver pieces

loans.name: Dúo Lindo Tecpán Group

texts.es:
Dúo Lindo Tecpán.
Doña Albina Adelaida tiene 3 hijos pequeños bajo su responsabilidad es originaria de Tecpan Guatemala, ella se dedica a la venta de muebles desde hace años ella se ha dedica a estas actividades con el fin de poder salir adelante con su familia, gracias al apoyo de su esposos ella lucha día a día por salir adelante,  está solicitando este crédito para la compra de muebles y para luego venderlos y así obtener ganancias para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Dúo Lindo Tecpán. Albina Adelaida has three small children under her responsibility. She is originally from Tecpán, Guatemala. She is engaged in selling furniture for years. She does these activities in order to get ahead with her family. Thanks to the support of his husband, she struggles every day to get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy furniture and then sell it and make a profit to support her family.

loans.use: to buy furniture for sale.

loans.name: Gilnis Yohana

texts.es:
La joven Gilnis tiene 27 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven sus 2 hijos y su esposo quien le apoya en su negocio propio lo que es venta de mercadería nueva,  actividad  que realiza desde hace 7 años en su ciudad donde vive,  su negocio  se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez es en gran cantidades ya que esta en el centro de la ciudad y esto hace la  visiten a diario.
Gilnis el crédito lo necesita para la compra pantalones, blusa, camisas, bóxer, calcetines y trajes de niños, el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas se incrementen, ya que tendrá una gran variedad de producto de buena calidad para satisfacer la necesidad y exigencias de sus clientes.
