Gilnis los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su actividad comercial día a día, como generarse buenos ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.

Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre de 2012
texts.en:
Gilnis is 27 years old and lives in the south of Honduras with her two children and her spouse, who supports her with her business. Gilnis has been selling new merchandise for the past 7 years in the city where she lives.  Her business is located in a strategic point of the center of the city, where there is a significant flow of people. As a result of this she gets daily customers. 
 Gilnis needs the loan to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, boxers, socks and children’s clothing. The expected impact of the loan will be an increase in her sales, as she will have a greater variety of quality products with which to satisfy the necessities and demands of her customers. 
Her plans for the future include increasing her commercial activity, so that she can get a good income to improve her and her family’s quality of life. 

Choluteca, Honduras- September 2012

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, boxers, socks and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Dúo Paz En La Tormenta Group

texts.es:
Dúo paz en la tormenta.
Doña Angélica Yolanda de 20 años de edad, Casada y tiene una hija pequeña es originaria de San Juan Comalapa, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos(GÜIPILES Y FAJAS) ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, su producto lo vende de forma ambulante ya que no tienen un local donde poder vender, está solicitando este ´crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos típicos.
texts.en:
Dúo paz en la tormenta group
Angélica Yolanda, 20, is married and has a young daughter. Angélica Yolanda is from San Juan Comalapa, and she makes her living weaving traditional fabrics (traditional tunics and woven belts), she has been performing this job for several years now. She sells her goods in the street as they do not have premises in which to sell. 

Angélica Yolanda is seeking this loan to buy the raw materials to weave traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials to weave traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia tiene 44 años  es una persona muy trabajadora y vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven sus hijos quienes son los que le ayudan en su actividad comercial, lo que es venta de abarrotería en general trabajo que realiza dese hace 15 años en la ciudad donde vive. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas es en grandes cantidades ya que esta en el centro de la cuidad.
Doña Eugenia el crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, carnes, pollo, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, manteca, jabón, aceite etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento es que sus ventas se incremente mucho, ya que compra variedad de productos de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de su clientes.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Eugenia es crecer día a día con su negocio y ser una de los mejores de la región, de igual manera generarse mejores ingresos parta tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2012
texts.en:
Eugenia, 44 years old, is a very hard working person who lives in the southern region of Honduras with her children. They help her with her business, which is a small grocery and general store that she started 15 years ago in the city where she lives. Her business has a strategic location in the center of the city, where great numbers of people pass by. Eugenia needs this loan to buy corn, meat, chicken, sugar, beans, rice, soft drinks, butter, soap, oil, etc. She hopes that this financing will increase her sales, as she will be able to buy a variety of products to satisfy the needs of each one of her customers.

Eugenia's future plans are to keep growing her business day by day and to become one of the best in the region, in order to generate more income and to achieve a better quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, meat, chicken, sugar, beans, rice, soft drinks, butter, soap, oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 64 years old, married and has four children. She is from Malibangcao, Clarin. To make a living, Erlinda has been running a general store for 13 years and earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2005, Erlinda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es: José Ismael casado con 51 anos de edad, con un hijo menor de 5 anos, José Ismael tiene por actividad económica la venta de artículos de ferretería, negocio que consisten en vender productos cerraduras, candados, grifos, tubo pvc, lámparas de mano, tubo, juegos de llaves, y tornillos,  destornilladores, palas, hachas, rastrillos, palo de lampazos. Tiene una experiencia de 14 anos en el negocio. y lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercado de su comunidad. Negocio que surgió con un préstamo de un familiar y comenzó a comprar productos de ferretería en la actualidad ha crecido gracias al apoyo que los inversionistas kiva le brindan y de igualmanera fundación  león 2000 por la confianza depositado, él ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo esta solicitando para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir un poco su ferretería con productos varios para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes. José Ismael agradece la ayuda que los inversionista kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo dignos.
texts.en:
José Ismael is 51 years old, married, and has a son who is under five years old. José Ismael's economic activity is the sale of hardware, business that consists in selling products such as locks, padlocks, faucets, PVC tubes, flashlights, tubes, sets of keys, screws, screwdrivers, shovels, axes, rakes, and mops sticks. He has an experience of 14 years in the business, which is located in one of the markets of his community. 

The business developed with a loan from a relative and he started buying hardware products. Today, it has grown thanks to the support provided by Kiva lenders and also Fundación León 2000 for its confidence. He has demonstrated his responsibility in paying in due time and form. 

He is requesting the financing to invest in working capital and stock better his hardware store with various products to satisfy his customers' demand. José Ismael is grateful for the help Kiva lenders are providing to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have decent jobs.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his small hardware store with products such as locks, padlocks, faucets, pvc tubes, flashlights, etc.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена живет и работает в Новой Каховке. Она занимается реализацией детской одежды в одном из популярных среди покупателей местных торговых центров. У Елены – свой магазин, в торговле она занята уже около 15 лет.  
Елене понадобилась сумма в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить осеннюю, зимнюю детскую одежду для реализации в холодное время года.
texts.en: Yelena lives and works in Novaya Kahovka. She sells children clothing in a popular shopping center in the city. Yelena has her own store in the shopping center where she has been working for 15 years. Yelena is requesting a loan of 4000 griven to purchase fall and winter children clothing for subsequent sale during the cold times of the year.

loans.use: to purchase fall and winter children clothing for resale

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Cветлана торгует в местном центральном универмаге женскими шапками, перчатками, шарфами, кожгалантереей, ремнями. У нее достаточный опыт в торговле. Она давно успела зарекомендовать себя как хороший, порядочный предприниматель. 
Светлана постоянно осуществляет поездки за товаром, следит за обновлением представленной у себя группы товаров. Данная сумма понадобилась Светлане для поездки за новым осенним товаром: шапки, шарфы и кожгалантерея.
texts.en: Svetlana sells women hats, gloves, scarves, leather goods and belts at the local shopping center. She has significant experience in retail and has developed a reputation as a good and conscientious businesswoman. Svetlana constantly travels to purchase more inventory and keep the selection of items offered in her store new and on-trend. Svetlana needs the current loan for her upcoming trip to purchase a new batch of hats, scarves and leather goods for the store.

loans.use: to purchase new fall inventory

loans.name: Mario Domingo

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 35 años de edad fabricante de ropa casual  y vive en Sololá. El es una persona  que a podido salir a delante aun por que tuvo la separación de su esposa y su hija. 
El se dedica a la elaboración de jeans para caballeros, niños y damas la cual los entrega en dos departamentos del país. Al inicio trabajo para una fabrica  elaborando estas prendas, pero ve que es un buen negocio y que los ingresos son aceptables para poder mantener a su vida junto a su madre,  decidió comprar su primera maquina para costura de telas así como su material primario para elaborar jeans
Este negocio lo inicio hace 2 años a tras, siendo así ahora el cuenta con tres maquinas para costura de tela. Ahora por la temporada del año el tiene que entregar una cantidad de jeans a unos proveedores la cual el necesita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de rollos de tela tipo lona y realizar la entrega de jeans variados, para obtener una mejor ganancia.
 Su mayor sueño es que más a delante ampliar  su negocio con mas maquinaria y material primario para luego expandir mas su producto en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Mario is a 35-year-old gentleman who manufactures casual clothing. He lives in Sololá and has been able to move forward after separating from his wife and daughter.

Mario produces jeans for men, children, and women. He delivers his goods within two departments of the country. Mario started out working at a clothing factory, but he saw that a good business could generate an acceptable level of income to support himself and his mother. He decided to buy his first sewing machine and fabrics for makings jeans.

Mario started his business two years ago. He now has three machines used for sewing fabric. During this time of the year, Mario needs to deliver a large quantity of jeans to one of his suppliers. Therefore, he needs a loan of 5,000 GTQ in order to buy rolls of canvas fabric for producing a variety of jeans. This will help him generate better earnings.

His greatest wish moving forward is to expand his business by acquiring more machinery and raw materials for expanding his product market to other places.

loans.use: to buy canvas fabric for producing jeans.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es: Heriberto de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su hija y su padre, él se dedica a la venta de artesanías tecomates, comales, ollas de barro, entre otros , tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le h regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en el lugar de su vivienda en una zona urbana muy transitada de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es elaborado con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio excelente; Heriberto es una hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor a su trabajo, como todo buen comerciante desea acrecentar el negocio y aumentar las ganancias, pero necesita de materia prima por eso le solicita a INTERAL un crédito que le permita comprar tecomates, ollas de barro, comales, etc. Heriberto tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá salda la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Heriberto is 56 years old and lives with his daughter and his father. He sells artisanal gourds, ceramic griddles and clay pots, among other items. He has had this business for several years, which has given him a lot of experience that helps him obtain better profits. The business is located in Heriberto's home, which is in an urban zone that is well-traveled by people. This has meant many customers, also because people know that everything Heriberto sells is made with top-quality materials, priced fairly, and that he provides excellent service. Heriberto is a man who is dedicated to his work, energetic, and has a great desire to get ahead. He is always on the lookout for new opportunities that could bring him success, and his biggest secret is the effort and love he puts into his work. Like any good merchant, he would like to grow his business and increase his earnings, but he needs materials in order to do so. This is why he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to buy gourds, clay pots, ceramic griddles, etc. Heriberto has good credit references and assures that he will be able to pay off his debt in the established period. He is also confident that he will provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gourds, clay pots, and ceramic griddles

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей уже около 14 лет занимается торговлей компьютерной техникой и комплектующими в своем родном городе Новая Каховка. У него пока нет своего собственного торгового места, он просто арендует торговую площадь у администрации местного торгового центра. Кроме торговли данной группой товаров, Андрей также предоставляет качественные услуги настройки и ремонта такой техники. 
У Андрея появилась необходимость пополнить комплектующие к ПК, поэтому он обратился за финансовой помощью к КИВА. Ему нужна сумма в размере 4 000 гривен.
texts.en: Andrei has been selling computers and parts for about 14 year in his home city of Novaya Kahovka. At this time Andrei still doesn't own a store but instead rents retail space in the local shopping center. Andrei not only sells computers and electronics but also offers quality installation and repair services for these products. Currently Andrei needs to purchase more accessories for personal computers and he has turned to KIVA for a loan of 4000 griven.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for personal computers

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is married and has 8 children. She is 46 years old and lives in Tonggo,Tudela. For the past 8 years, Trinidad has been farming, growing vegetable crops to earn a living. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Trinidad has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en: Charlie, 44 years old, is married and has six children. He provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. Charlie has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 300 PHP daily. Charlie is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase equipment such as wheels, paint, oil and gas to improve his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase equipment such as wheels, paint, oil and gas

loans.name: Heide

texts.en: Heide, 31 years old, lives in Pob.3, Clarin. She is married and has 1 child. For the past 6 years, Heide has operated a store that sells a variety of products. She has requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Heide has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; la socia continua dedicandose a la  agricultura sembrando verduras como zanahoria, lechuga,cebolla entre otros ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia vende su mercaderia en las  ferias sabatinas en uno de los mercado de la ciudad del Cusco,la socia es una persona resposanble y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su chacra.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the communal bank 'Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata', which is located in Yuncaypata in the province and department of Cusco.

Julia works in agriculture, growing vegetables like carrots, lettuce and onions, among others. She has done this work for years, and it has been going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts in every day, She sells her produce at the Saturday markets in the city of Cusco.

Julia is a responsible person and works hard to support her family. She is asking for this loan to buy seeds and fertilisers for her farm. The loan will make her very happy and she promises to keep up with her repayments.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertiliser for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow green beans

loans.name: Dúo Perlas Cristalinas Group

texts.es: Dúo Perlas Cristalinas, Mayra Janeth de 31 años de edad es originaria de Antigua Guatemala,ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad, desde hace años ella se ha dedicado a esta activida ya que de esta forma es como ayuda a su familia,ella sueña con tener una tienda mas grande, pero para eso tiene que invertir mas, es por eso que está solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Dúo Perlas Cristalinas Group ("Crystal Pearls Duo") includes Mayra Janeth, 31 years old, who sells staple food items. She has dedicated herself to this business for several years and it is how she helps her family. She dreams of having a larger store but to achieve that she would need to invest more. This is why she is requesting a loan. She will use this loan to purchase staple food products.

loans.use: to buy staple food items

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана уже не первый раз убеждается в своевременности и надежности кредитов от КИВА. В последний раз, когда она воспользовалась этими финансовыми услугами, полученная сумма была направлена на развитие бизнеса. За счет получения дополнительной прибыли Светлана смогла позволить себе обустроить детскую комнату для внучки. 
В этот раз Светлана обратилась в КИВА в этот раз для того, чтобы получить сумму в размере 4 000 гривен и закупить сезонную женскую одежду для реализации на своей торговой точке. За счет получения дополнительной прибыли от этого кредита Светлана планирует приобрести дочери новую бытовую технику.
texts.en: Svetlana has been time and again convinced of timeliness and reliability of KIVA loans. Last time she used our lending service the loan helped her further expand her business. Svetlana used the profits from the expansion to redecorate her grand daughter's room. This time Svetlana has turned to KIVA for a loan of 4000 griven which she will use to purchase a batch of seasonal women's clothes for sale at her fashion store. She is planning to use the profits from this loan to purchase new appliances for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's clothing for resale at her store

loans.name: Levy

texts.en: Levy, 42 years old, is married and has 5 children. She lives in the Philippines. Levy has cultivated coconuts for 8 years, earning a monthly income of 5,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for farm maintenance. Levy has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she hopes to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, 51, is married and has six children. She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business for two years.  She aims to increase her profits because she needs more funds to pay her two younger children's school fees. Due to the high cost of tuition fees, Agnes is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy one box of vinegar, oil and soy sauce, canned goods, biscuits and breads. She believes that she can improve her income if her requested loan is approved.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, oil, soy sauce, canned goods, biscuits and breads

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Emprendedoras, se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, con diez integrantes, ellas están muy contentas por la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya. El grupo siguió, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; quienes poseen actividad  económica y son muy trabajadoras.
Siria es parte de este desafío y cuenta que hace todo tipo de Bijouteries, como ser cadenas, pulseras, y también las compra y revende. Tiene buena clientela, ya que tiene todo tipo de artículos y es lo que más atrae a las personas.
Siria solicita el crédito para la compra de más Bijouteries, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas y dar todo tipo de variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is in its second loan cycle with 10 members. They are very pleased with the opportunity that Fundación Paraguaya has given them. The group continues to demonstrate unity and solidarity among its members. They all have their own businesses and are extremely hardworking.

Siria is a part of this group. She produces all types of trinkets, such as necklaces and bracelets, but she also buys and resells these items. Siria has a good customer base and offers all types of products, which helps her to attract business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more trinkets so that she can continue her sales and offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy trinkets to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 61 años de edad. Se  compro una vitrina y perchas de allí ella vende laminas, cuadernos hasta artículos de bazar. Ella Atiende su pequeño negocio sola. Ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Ella cuenta que al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio  pero poco a poco ha ido mejorando esas condiciones pues ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio y su sueño es ampliarlo más para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que dio a día le compran en su bazar. Y Ella cuenta que quisiera arreglar su vivienda y el sueño de ella es comprarse un carro. Con el préstamo quisiera comprar: artículos para el bazar, papeles, láminas,  etc.
texts.en:
Pilar, 61, bought herself a display case and stands where she sells paper, notebooks, and gift items.  She tends her small business alone, working from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m.

She says that in the beginning there was a lot of crime in the area and her business wasn't very productive.  Little by little conditions have improved, however, and now it's going very well for her in the business.  Her dream is to expand it more to be able to satisfy the demands of all the daily customers in her store.  She says she would like to fix up her home and that her dream is to buy a car.

With the loan she wants to buy papers, gift items, etc.

loans.use: to buy paper, gift items, etc.

loans.name: Luis Olivo

texts.es: Luis tiene 55 años de edad  estado civil casado, tiene 3 hijos, desde hace tiempo él se compro un carrito, pero como no encontraba un trabajo fijo, el puso su carro para convertirlo en taxi amigo pues ese ha sido la fuente de dinero con lo que gano de taxista sustento a mi familia. Con el préstamo él quiere sacar permisos y afiliarse a una cooperativa
texts.en: Luis, 55, is married and has three children. Some time ago, he bought a cart, but because he couldn't find steady work, he converted his car into a taxi that has been his source of income. He says this income allows him to support his family. He will use the loan to buy licenses and join a cooperative.

loans.use: to buy licenses and join a cooperative.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Valentina es una de las miembros, es una persona activa y promueve el fortalecimiento del comité. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo y es con este trabajo que está saliendo adelante y ayuda a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y demás bebidas para poder surtir su negocio y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
This committee is from the City of San Lorenzo. The committee members have set their main objective as growth for each one of them, not only economically, but also personally. They are recognized in their area as being very hard-working women. 

Valentina is one of the members. She is an active person who promotes the strengthening of the committee. She works selling beverages of all types, and with this work she is getting ahead and helping her family. 

She is requesting the loan to buy beer, wine, soft drinks and other beverages so that she can stock her business and continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy a range of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: María de Jesús tiene 61 años estado civil viuda. Ella cuenta que desde que su esposo falleció ella  se hizo a cargo del negocio que llevaban los 2 juntos, que era la venta de frutas y legumbres en un kiosco pues el trabajo de ella es desde las 6.00am hasta 10.00pm. el sueño de ella es que su negocio crezca y llegar a ser una distribuidora de frutas para otras tiendas. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar más :frutas, legumbres y otros víveres
texts.en: María de Jesús is 61 and widowed. She says that since her husband died, she has managed the business they had together: selling fruits and vegetables from a kiosk. She works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. She dreams of seeing her business grow and of becoming a fruit dealer to other stores. She will use the loan to buy fruits, vegetables, and other food stuffs.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and other food stuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Charieden

texts.en: Charieden, 24 years old, is engaged in selling snacks. She makes “kakanin” (Filipino snacks or desserts made from rice, sweet rice or root vegetables that are slow cooked and usually made with coconut or coconut milk) in order to provide for her child's necessities. Charieden's business is a great help to her family so she wants to develop it. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy rice cakes, coconut, milk, sugar and oil as raw material in making “kakanin”. Charieden hopes that her loan will be approved.

loans.use: to buy rice cakes, coconut, milk, sugar and oil

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; el socio Sergio continua dedicandose a su trabajo de construccion ,el socio trabaja para las distintas obras que solicitan sus servicios dentro del poblado y fuera tambien,el socio trabaja de forma independiente ,el socio lleva años dedicandose a este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.


El socio solicita el credito para la compra de algunas herramientas que necesita como cierras y badilejos.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member, Sergio, belongs to Virgen del Carmen de Yucaypata Communal Bank.  He continues making a living in construction, working on various jobs that request his services, both in town and outside.  He works on his own and has been doing this job for years.  It's going well for him because of the effort he puts into his job every day.  He's a responsible and hardworking person, which is how he gets his family ahead.

He's requesting the loan to buy some tools he needs such as saws and trowels.

He's grateful for the loan and pledges to be disciplined in making his payments.

loans.use: to buy tools such as saws and trowels

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy basic materials for producing traditional textiles.

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.ru:
Евгения использовала предыдущий кредит от КИВА для того, чтобы закупить канцтовары  и разные подарки к праздникам. Со времени получения прошлого кредита она заметила, что немного упала выручка. Однако это сезонная тенденция: приближается зима, а зимой торговля совсем плохая. 
Евгении понадобилась дополнительная сумма в 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить  партию канцтоваров, а именно тетради, учебники и другие товары для школьников и студентов. Осенью хорошо идет этот товар, за счет чего есть возможность увеличить и свою прибыль.
texts.en: Yevgeniya has used her previous KIVA credit to purchase office supplies and presents for the holidays. Since her last loan she noticed that her profits have dropped. This is a seasonal fluctuation - winter is coming and sales always drop in winter. Yevgeniya needs to take an additional loan of 4000 griven to purchase a batch of office supplies, specifically notebooks, textbook and other goods for students. Despite the seasonal downturn in most sales, school supplies sell rapidly in the fall and Yevgeniya is hoping to increase her profits again with this strategy.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies, specifically notebooks, textbooks and other items for school kids and college students

loans.name: Yulia

texts.ru:
Юлия живет и работает в Новой Каховке. В городе есть несколько крупных торговых центров. В одном из них Юлия арендует торговую площадь и торгует там стильной и модной женской одеждой. В торговле работает уже 7 лет. 
Юлия запланировала закупку осенней одежды для реализации в осенне-зимний период, а именно хочет приобрести кофты, свитера, юбки и брюки на сумму в 4 000 гривен
texts.en: Yulia lives in Novaya Kahovka. The town has several shopping centers and Yulia rents retail space in one and sells stylish and fashionable women's clothes. She has had her business for 7 years. Yulia is planning to purchase a batch of fall clothing for resale during the fall-winter season, specifically she wants to purchase cardigans, sweaters, skirts and slacks using the loan of 4000 griven.

loans.use: to purchase cardigans, sweaters, skirts and slacks

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old, married, and basically lives with her three children. She is selling in the village different “kakanin” (snacks usually made with or containing any combination of coconut milk, rice flour, glutinous rice, cassava and sugar) like bibingka, puto, and suman.

To offer more goods, she is asking for a loan amount of PHP 5,000 to buy sugar, milk, and coconut as ingredients in making “kakanin”. 

Delia is looking forward to the betterment of their lifestyle through her loan amount.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, and coconut as ingredients in making “kakanin”.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline, 31 years old, is a single mother of a 3-year-old child. For the past 3 years, she has operated a business selling phone accessories, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Pauline has requested a second loans of KES 30,000 to purchase new phones, batteries, housings and chargers. The profit earned through this loan will be reinvestsed in her business. Pauline dreams of owning a big communications company and becoming an employer.

loans.use: To purchase new phones, batteries, housings and chargers.

loans.name: Jilhani

texts.en:
Jilhani is 54 years old and married. He lives in Sta. Cruz, Ozamis City. 

Jilhani owns and operates a business venture selling a variety of used clothes products (ukay-ukay) to earn a living.  He has been 10 years in this business. Each month, he earns PHP 20,000 doing this type of business. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase more items to expand his product offerings. In 2011, Jilhani joined GDMPC1. 

Positively, he simply hopes for the business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to expand his product offerings.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a woman of thirty-seven years. She is married to Simon and they have one child. She lives in Kawangware in Nairobi. She owns rental houses in Kawangware. She has been in this business for five years now and gets a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to renovate the houses and also buy new furniture for her office. 

In the future, she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is married, with two children. She is 54 years old and lives in Yahong, Tudela. 

Maxima owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for eight years and earns PHP 5,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 7,500 to purchase farm chemicals. Maxima been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2011. 

In the future, Maxima's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Maria Sara

texts.es: María Sara  de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia, ella se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy conocido por las personas del lugar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; María es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor y un gran éxito para el futuro, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa interior, tela, hilos, etc. María Sara tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
María Sara, 38, lives with her life partner and her son in their own house. She makes and sells clothing, a business she has had for some years. She has gained much experience that lets her generate very good profits. The business is in her house and is well-known to her neighbors. She has built a solid clientele because her customers know that her quality is very good, her prices are affordable, her service is unequaled, and that she always wants to meet their needs.

María is enterprising, dedicated, and hardworking. Day after day, she puts all her effort into improving her life and achieving success. She has seen an increase in demand in the past weeks and wants to take this opportunity to make another investment; however, she lacks sufficient capital to do so. So she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy underwear, cloth, and thread. María Sara has good credit references and integrity. She says she will be able to pay the debt, and, at the same, she expects to bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy underwear, cloth, and thread.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa es soltera  y no tiene hijos .empezó su negocio hace años muchos años atrás  vendiendo varios productos, pero ella  siempre ha sido comerciante y le gusta innovar. 
En la actualidad ella trabaja sola de lunes a domingos de 6:00 am hasta 5:00 pm .  La meta de Rosa es que su negocio crezca, para tener más ingresos y poder terminar de construir su casa. Con el prestamo quiere comprar para su tienda víveres como: aceites, granos, dulces, confites, bebidas gaseosas etc.
texts.en:
Rosa is single and has no children. She started her business many years ago, selling various products; but she has always been a businessperson, and likes to innovate. 

Currently, she works on her own, Monday to Friday, from 6:00am to 5:00pm. Rosa's goal is to see her business grow, so that she can have more income and finish building her home. With the loan, she wants to buy groceries for her store, such as oils, grains, candy, soft drinks etc.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, grains, candy, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Aty  son todas de la zona de San Lorenzo  son 12 integrantes  muy responsables. Todas son mamas muy responsables y trabajadoras se reúnen siempre para resolver cualquier problema del grupo ayudan a su comunidad siempre y entre ellas también todas para que así puedan salir adelante juntas.
Una de las miembros y presidenta es Monica, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas en general. Cuenta que gracias al apoyo de la fundación y de su grupo está saliendo adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de camisas, bermudas, camisillas y demás prendas de verano, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere tener buena variedad.
texts.en:
The 12 very responsible members of Kuña Aty Communal Bank are all from the San Lorenzo area.  All are very responsible and hardworking mothers who always meet to resolve whatever problem.  The group helps the community and each other so they can always get ahead together.

One of the members is Monica, the president, who makes a living selling general clothing.  She says that she's getting ahead thanks to the help of the foundation and her group, and that she helps her family with her job.

She's requesting the loan to buy shirts, Bermuda shorts, tank tops, and other summer clothing because the hot weather is coming and she wants to have a good variety.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is married with three children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Roberta is a farmer and grows crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan of 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizer.

Roberta has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Roberta hopes to have a big business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, 35 years old, is married. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Evelyn has 4 grown children who have helped her in taking care of the family's banana and coconut production. They have been in this work for 5 years and earn 6,000 PHP a month. Evelyn recently joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs. Evelyn hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and to pay for weeding costs

loans.name: Zion Group

texts.en: Alma is married and has five children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. For the past 30 years, Alma has been farming vegetables and rice crops. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm. Alma has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her farm area and to be a distributor of rice in the neighboring area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Henery

texts.en:
Henery, 39 years old, is married to Nancy and has two children. He sells home products such as food flasks, spoons, etc. from house to house. Henery has been in this business for two years, earning a monthly income of 14,000 KES.

This will be Henery's second loan with KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy flasks, spoons etc. In the future, Henery wants to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy new stock such as food flasks

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Saroen, a 55-year-old married father, lives in a rural area of the Sangke District of Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has five children, two of whom are dependent on him and still in school. To make a living, he has been farming rice for 33 years and working as a construction worker in the local area, while his wife is a homemaker and also raises cows. Saroen can earn approximately 30,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield is the main challenge for his rice paddy.

Saroen received the first loan from Kiva’s partner VisionFund two cycles ago and has successfully paid back the loans, which have helped him better support the current business. Now he is leading his group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, Saroen will use his portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice successfully and enlarge his income to better his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
Thom is 54 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is in her care. Her family lives in a rural area of the Preahnet Preah district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. 

The primary source of her family‘s income is rice farming on two hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for 29 years and earns about KHR 20,000.  She manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulted from drought is the main challenge for her rice field.

Thom’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for one cycle. She fully repaid the loan, which constantly supported her family with enough food and basic necessities. 

She is now leading her group to ask for a loan from VIsionFund of KHR1,000,000 each. Thom is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her current business to earn a larger income.  That will make convenient living conditions for her family and also fulfill her dream of having a decent house for living in.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a 52-year-old widow and a resident of Liposong, Ozamis City. She provides her four children's needs from the little amount of 7,000 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business. She's had the business for five years as an aid to the income gained. However, in 2007 she became a member of GDMPC. 

She applied for a loan at GDMPC Microfinance for 10,000 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Nena wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single lady of 55 years; she has one child aged 23 years. 

She operates a retail shop in Ngarariga in Limuru. Lilian has been in this business for 12 years and gets a monthly income of KES 18,000.


This will be Lilian's sixth loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to add stock to her business and buy things like rice, sugar, cooking oil, and maize flour. 


In future, she wants to educate her son and also provide for his basic needs.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Dúo La Sexta Group

texts.es: Dúo la Sexta. Se encuentra conformada por  Ana Delia de 25 años de edad, soltera y originaria del municipio de San Juan Sacatepequez. se dedica a  la actividad de tejidos, Ana nos cuenta que aprendió este trabajo al lado de su mama desde los 10 años de edad, por lo que desde muy  pequeña    conoció  esta actividad artesanal,ahora ella se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos tipicos a mano está solicita  un crédito para poder comprar hilos, en cantidades mayores para ahorrarse cierta cantidad de dinero y tener disponibilidad de material para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Ana Delia is one of the two members of Dúo la Sexta (The Sixth Duo). Ana is 25 years old, she is single, she comes from the municipality of San Juan Sacatepequez, and she engages in weaving textiles. Ana has told us that she has learned this activity form her mother, working at her side since she was 10 years old. Since she was very young she has therefore practiced this craft activity, and she now engages in weaving typical handmade textiles. She is requesting a loan to buy thread in larger quantities in order to save some money and to supply herself with materials she needs to keep on working.

loans.use: To buy thread at wholesale prices.

loans.name: San José Obrero Group

texts.es:
El comité San José Obrero nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de un grupo de mujeres que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar. Este comité es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo y tiene 18 miembros.
La Sra. Olga, presidenta del grupo tiene 36 años, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora  y capaz de liderar un grupo numeroso como lo es este, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación. Ella tiene una cantina, y solicita el crédito para poder surtirlo con golosinas, bebidas, comestibles y demás.
Todas ellas agradecen por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en: The communal bank San José Obrero began under the management and support of a group of women who were working in this town. The group is from the city of San Lorenzo and has 18 members. Olga, president of the group, is 36, enterprising, and capable of leading a large group such as this one. She has shown her determination to succeed during previous loan cycles. She has a canteen and is requesting a loan to stock it with sweets, beverages, foodstuffs, and more. The women thank Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for their help.

loans.use: to buy sweets, beverages, foodstuffs, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her daughter's business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, 31 years old, is married to Martin and has two children. For the past 12 years, she has run a retail shop in Limuru. Agnes also keeps pigs on her farm. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

This will be Agnes' second loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy stock, such as sugar, soft drinks, rice, maize flour, etc. for her shop. In the future, Agnes wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To add stock such as rice, sugar and soft drinks

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
El Sauce es un municipio que pertenece al departamento de León, en él habita Pedro Antonio, es un profesor de 37 años con muchos años de experiencia, de los muchos que hay en dicho municipio con una profesión  merecedora y motivante porque gracias a estas personas hoy se han forjado grandes profesionales que son el desarrollo de nuestro país.

Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos para reparar su motocicleta ya que es su principal medio de transporte para trasladarse a su centro de trabajo el cual queda ubicado en una comarca fuera del municipio.

Está muy agradecido con KIVA y Ceprodel por este período que tiene de trabajar con ellos y que le han brindado su mano amiga con el apoyo de estos créditos que aseguran el futuro de las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a community locates in the department of León. Pedro Antonio lives here: he is a 37-year-old professor with many years of experience. He is one of the may inhabitants of this community to have a worthy and inspiring job, since the great professionals that constitute the development of this country have been shaped thanks to people like him.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to repair his motorcycle, his main transportation mean. He uses it to reach his working place, located in a rural area away from his community.

He is deeply grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the time he has been working with them: they have offered him a helping hand thorough their loans, a supporting way to guarantee a future to those people who are mostly in need.

.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Karina Alexandra

texts.es: Karina  de estado civil soltero, tiene 1 hija de 5 años , Ella nos dice que a pesar de que ha sido madre soltera siempre ha estado junto a su hija en todo tiempo ya que hubo un tiempo que estaba desempleada , pero eso no fue impedimento para salir a delante , Ella dice pues que con ganas  todo se puede .Ya que siempre desde pequeña le ha gustado el mundo de las ventas .pues en la actualidad ella se dedica a eso en su casa pone a la venta unos cosméticos y también sale a vender a sus clientes. Con el préstamo va a comprar :shampoo, colonias, talcos etc.
texts.en:
Karina is single and has a five-year-old daughter. Despite being a single mother, Karina says that she and her daughter are always together since she was unemployed at one time. However, this did not keep her from moving forward. She says that she accomplishes everything she sets out to do. From a very young age, Karina has enjoyed making sales. At the moment, she sells cosmetics out of her home but she also goes out to sell them to her customers.

With this loan she will buy shampoo, colognes, talcum powders, and other products.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, colognes, talcum powders, and other products.

loans.name: Itaugua Poty Group

texts.es:
El comite de Itaugua Poty  es un trabajador grupo formado por 16 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Ellas decidieron formar parte del comité para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y de esa forma ir mejorando el estilo de vida de cada una y la de sus familias.
Cristhiany es un ejemplo de lucha, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, y lo hace para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan y de esa forma no dejar que pasen por ningún tipo de necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos de toda marca, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ganando los ingresos con los cuales ayudara a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Itaugua Poty" communal bank is a hard-working group made up of 16 women in the city of San Lorenzo. They decided to join the group in order to be able to help one another, and that way gradually improve the lifestyle of each member and that of their families.

Cristhiany is an example of perseverance, as she sells cosmetics. She does this to provide her family with everything they need, and that way not let them undergo the type of hardships that she had to. 

She is requesting the loan in order to buy cosmetics of every brand, so that in that way she can continue earning the income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella se dedica al servicio de transporte con su esposo , ya hace 16 años ya con clientela formada, tienen hijos, pero  todos ya mayores.
Con mucho esfuerzo logro comprar su vehículo y trabajar en ello. Solicita el crédito para el arreglo de su vehículo (chaperia y pintura) ya que prestara servicio a una empresa y debe de estar en buenas condiciones. Sueña con tener otro vehículo y dar más fuente de trabajo a personas de su cuidad
texts.en: Maria is from the city of San Lorenzo. She has been working as a driver with her husband for 16 years and has built a clientele. They have adult children. With much effort, she managed to buy her car and uses it for her job. She is asking for a loan to paint and repair her car since she provides transport service to a business, and the car needs to be in good condition. Her dream is to own another vehicle and employ other people in the city.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos tiene 26 años de edad estado civil casado, tiene 1hijo. El comenta que empezó trabajando con su hermano, ambos trabajaban para un señor que les enseño el oficio de hacer zapatillas, ahora él se independizo y tiene un negocio de venta de zapatillas. El trabaja de 8:00am hasta 18:00pm lo realiza con empleados que el contrato. Con el préstamo el quiere comprar: tiras, fibras etc.
texts.en: Carlos is 26 years old and married with one child.  He comments that he began working with his brother.  They both worked for a man who taught them the shoemaking trade.  Now, he has become independent and he has his own business selling shoes.  He works from 8:00am until 6:00pm with the employees he has contracted.  With this loan, he wants to purchase straps, synthetic fibers, etc.

loans.use: to purchase straps, synthetics fibers, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with six children.  She is 69 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.

Thelma is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 20 years.  She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers, such as fertilizers which are inorganic and commercial.  Thelma has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Thelma hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, such as fertilizers which are inorganic and commercial.

loans.name: Kot's Group

texts.en:
Kot, 42 years old, lives in a village in the MoungKol Borey district of Banteat Meanchey province with his spouse and three children. To support the family, he has been farming rice on a one-hectare piece of farmland, supplementing his income by working for others. Kot's daily income is approximately 18,000 KHR, of which he manages to save about 8,000 KHR after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for Kot's paddy business. 

Kot has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely repaid his loans. The other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Kot wisely and successfully used his past loans to constantly support his family's livelihood. Now he and his group member are requesting a loan of 300,000 KHR each. As the leader, Kot will use his portion to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farmland. He hopes to grow his rice successfully and increase his business income to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor is a 28-year-old married woman who supports 2 family members. She is from Ashrafia, Amman, Jordan. Noor is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to pay for clothes and cosmetic products to resell. In the future, she hopes to increase her products to increase her family income. Since Noor is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan

loans.use: to pay for clothes and cosmetic products to resell

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Arsenia is single and has no children. She is 49 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. For the past 10 years, Arsenia has been farming rice. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers, such as inorganic and commercial. Arsenia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a 52-year-old widowed mother of three children.  For more than 10 years in Segatic Diot, Clarin, she has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns PHP 6,000 a month from these activities.

In 2004, Trinidad joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 11,500 to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Sour's Group

texts.en:
Sour is a 59-year-old mother of seven children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school.  She lives in a thatched roof house with her husband in a rural village of the Moungkol Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province.

The main source of the family’s income is rice farming on three hectares of farmland.  Her husband helps the family to earn additional income by working as a paid worker in local area. Together, they can earn about KHR 30,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 20,000 each day after deducting daily expenses. Insufficient working capital to support the rice-paddy business is the main challenge.

Sour has been a member of VisionFund for six cycles, while the other members of her group have been with VisionFund from four to five cycles. The past loans, which Sour has completely paid back, have relieved her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land. Through this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from her farming business, so as to keep up a good progress of her lifestyle and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer pesticides for her cultivated land.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Vanessa Elizabeth

texts.es: Vanessa Elizabeth  de veinte años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, lechuga, tomate, chile, zanahoria, rábano, pepino, plátano, naranja entre otros, tiene varios años con el trabajo y se ha hecho de experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado de la alcaldía de la comunidad donde reside ya tiene mucha clientela fija,  pues es muy conocida y las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan, con producto de calidad y a precios accesibles además de un excelente servicio; Vanessa es una mujer activa, dedica a su labor y con muchas metas por delante, todos los días trabaja muy duro por alcanzarlos sabe que solo así logrará el éxito; como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero para ello necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar fruta y verdura por mayor; Vanessa tiene buena referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vanessa Elizabeth, 28, lives with her life partner and their children. She sells fruits and vegetables: lettuce, tomatoes, chiles, carrots, radishes, cucumbers, plantains, oranges, and others. She has been a merchant for several years and has gained the sales experience necessary to increase her profits. Her stall is in the mayor's market in her neighborhood. She has regular customers because she is well-known. People prefer to shop with her because she always has what they need, her quality is good, her prices are affordable, and her service is excellent.

Vanessa is active, dedicated to her work, and has many goals. She works very hard each day to reach these goals and, thereby, achieve success. Like every good merchant, she wants to grow her business and make new investments. She needs capital to do so and has applied for a loan with INTEGRAL to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables. Vanessa has good credit references and is very responsible. She is certain she will repay the loan while giving her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single man who is 37 years old and the father of one child who is seven years old. His business is to sell motor vehicle spare parts in Limuru, and he has been doing so for seven years now. Peter gets a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This will be Peter's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy motor vehicle spare parts for resale. In the future, he wants to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
Pacienca is 73 years old and lives in Canibungan Daku, Clarin. Paciencia is widowed, with four children. 

Paciencia has a motorcycle business and earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan to purchase an additional tube tire for her vehicle.

Paciencia has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Paciencia hopes to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional tube tire for her vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for blankets, perfumes, and mobiles to resell

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is 32 years old and a farmer who lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district of Cambodia. She is responsible for two children, both of whom are in school. 

To make a living, she has been involved in planting cassava and also running a small grocery store in local area, where she sells grocery items such as fruit juice, water, and cake.  Engaging in this business for eight years, she is able to earn about KHR 40,000 for her family’s needs.

Sopheap’s group consists of two members who have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. She has fully repaid the loan, which has helped her success in securing food needs for her family. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sopheap will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying more grocery items for selling. 

Through this loan, she hopes to get a high yield from her rice paddy and earn a large income for the family so as to better their lifestyle..

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Olivia Alicia

texts.es:
Olivia Alicia esta casada, tiene 19 años de edad, estudio su educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijo el cual no esta no esta estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, inicio este trabajo gracias al apoyo de sus padres y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos para incrementar su volumen de producción, y el el futuro quiere tener mas empleados y así mejorar la condición de vida de otras familias y de su propia familia.
texts.en:
Olivia Alicia is 19 years old, married, and has an elementary school education. She has one child who is not attending school. Olivia is a weaver and started in this line of work with the support of her parents. As of this date, she has 10 years of experience. She also receives assistance from her husband who provides financial support.

Olivia is requesting a loan so that she can buy thread in order to increase her production volume. In the future, she hopes to have more employees and be able to improve her family’s living conditions and those of other families.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria Elizabeth de 25 años de edad, es originaria de barrio el Calvario, ella desde hace 2 años inicio su venta de Zapatos en variedad tiene su venta en un centro comercial de San Martin, a Dios gracias su negocio a crecido  y por eso se a visto en la necesidad de solicitar este crédito para la compra de Zapatos por mayor ya que necesita tener más estilos en diseños y tamaño, espera que por medio de kiva le puedan ayudar y darle ese apoyo que necesita para salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria Elizabeth is 25 years old and originally from the neighborhood of Calvario. Two years ago, she began selling a variety of shoes from a store located in a shopping center in San Martin. She thanks God that her business has grown.

Gloria Elizabeth is requesting a loan so that she can buy shoes in bulk because she needs to offer more styles, designs, and sizes. With the assistance and support that Kiva has provided, she expects to move forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk.

loans.name: 6 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE MARZO”  iniciará el decimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ricarda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de pan, joyería, tienda de barrio, costura de chamarras y mantas, venta de CD’s, pensión, macramé de mantas, carpintería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ricarda es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una socia que es participante en la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa que trabaja hace años atrás, emprendiendo este negocio por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras por mayor posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “6 de Marzo" communal bank will begin its 1th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, through the Panamericana regional office. It is composed of eight members, and is led by a board of directors, of which Ricarda is the chair. The businesses that the members of the group carry on are varied, and include: sale of bread, jewelry, neighborhood store, sewing jackets and shawls, sale of CDs, boarding house, weaving macramé shawls, and carpentry. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small entrepreneurs like Ricarda. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago at the invitation of a member who is a participant in the institution. Currently she has a business selling potatoes, that she has worked in for some years, and that she launched through her own initiative.
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her working capital, by buying potatoes that she will buy from the wholesalers and subsequently sell at her stand. This form of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family as much as she can, as she is single and has five children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic.

loans.use: To buy potatoes.

loans.name: Rudy Rocael

texts.es:
El señor Rudy Rocael esta casado, tiene 21 años de edad, estudio hasta terminar sus estudios de perito contador, se dedica a prestar sus servicios de contador y también a dirigir un negocio de costura y producción de blusas juntamente con su esposa, inicio este negocio graci9as al apoyo de su mamá, y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas de varios colores, para la producción de blusas, espera en el futuro tener un local propio, para venta de los guipiles.
texts.en:
Rudy Rocael is married, 21, and is studying to become a certified accountant. He offers accounting services and also runs a business designing and making blouses with his wife. The business, which he started with his mother's support, is 5 years old. 

He is applying for a loan to buy fabric in a variety of colors to make blouses. He hopes some day to have his own shop where he will sell traditional hand-embroidered garments.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make blouses.

loans.name: Nemeh

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Nemeh prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Nemeh is a 32-year-old married woman with 5 children. She is from Madaba, Jordan. Nemeh has requested a 1,200 JOD loan to pay for retailing construction supplies. In the future, she wants to expand her project and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for retailing construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her business

loans.name: Nancy De Las Mercedes

texts.es: Nancy tiene  47 años de edad  estado civil casada tiene hijos mayores de edad ella era ayudante en un salón de belleza pero un día la jefa tuvo que vender su negocio porque se fue a los estados unidos, de ahí fue entonces que ella decidió ponerse un salón de belleza, en la actualidad tiene un salón de negocio la cual labora sola de 9:00am hasta 21:00pm lo hace de lunes a domingo. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar. Crema de tratamiento y mejorar la infraestructura de local
texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old, married and has adult children. She used to be an assistant in a beauty salon, but her employer had to sell the business in order to move to the United States. 

It was then that she decided to open a beauty salon. She currently has a salon in which she works alone from 9 a.m. until 9 p.m. from Monday to Sunday.

With the loan she intends to buy hair mask and improve the infrastructure of her premises.

loans.use: to buy hair mask and improve the infrastructure of her premises.

loans.name: Maria Angel

texts.es: María Ángel de cuarenta y dos años de edad  vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, pan, huevos, embutidos, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, esta ubicada en su vivienda y es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad por lo que ya tiene clientela fija que la prefiere por los buenos precios, la calidad y el servicio excelente; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor y a toda su familia son las dos cosas mas importantes en su vida, se esfuerza todos los días por ofrecerles un futuro mejor y una vida digna, esta pendiente de todo lo que necesitan, en los últimos meses la casa ha tenido deterioros y necesita reparaciones para seguridad y comodidad de los que la habitan, pero María no cuenta con el suficiente capital que la respalde por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tejas, cemento, piso, herramientas etc., María Ángel tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
María Ángel, 42, lives with her life partner and their sons in their own house. She has a store where she sells basic items such as grains, milk, bread, eggs, and canned goods. She has had the business, which is in her house, for several years and has gained sales experience. The store is well-known to neighbors and has a steady clientele who like the good prices, quality, and excellent service.

María is dedicated to her work and family, the two most important things in her life. She works hard each day to offer her family a better future, a decent life, and all their needs. In recent months, the house has suffered some damage, and she needs to do repairs to ensure that it is safe and comfortable for all those who live there. María says she doesn't have enough capital to do this, so she is applying for a loan with INTEGRAL to buy roof tiles, cement, flooring, tools, and so forth. 

María Ángel has good credit references and is very responsible. She believes she will be able to repay the loan on time and also offer her family a fuller life.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles, cement, flooring, and tools.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is a 38 year old independent woman.  She lives in Pakistan with her husband, two daughters and son. Both of her daughters are students, while her son is an auto mechanic.  

Khalida is a very hard-working tailor, and her husband is a taxi driver. They are living in a rented house and sometimes she doesn't have enough money to pay the rent. Khalida is interested in increasing her business. To do that as a member of 10 person lending group, she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new sewing machine. With the profits, she wants to open a boutique shop in which she can sell beautifully stitched clothes.  She also wants her son to start a new business, and for that, she will be investing some amount. 

Khalida dreams of a better future for her children, and her husband's good health. She wants to spend a healthy and simple life with family. Many thanks from her to all staff of Kiva.

Note: In the picture, Khalida is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Kimsrea's Group

texts.en:
Kimsrea, 53 years old, is a married mother who has been blessed with nine children. She resides in a rural area of the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. Out of her nine children, she still has two to take care of and they are in school. To support the family, Kimsrea has been selling rice soup in the local area and her husband grows rice. Having worked in this business for five years, Kimsrea and her husband earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day, of which they manage to save about KHR 10,000 after offsetting daily expenses. 

Kimsrea is in her first loan cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is the leader of a group consisting of two women. She and her group member would like to acquire loans of KHR 1,000,000 and KHR 150,000 respectively from VisionFund. Kimsrea will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Elrose

texts.en: Elrose is married and has two children. She is 24 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past 5 years, Elrose has raised pigs for sale, earning a montly income of 5,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Elrose has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since 2009. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Canelitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CANELITA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gloria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: elaboración de frituras, servicio de hospedaje, tienda de barrio, brostería, elaboración de empanadas, artesanía, salón de belleza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gloria es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia con un poco capital y deseos de superación.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el incremento de capital (compra de víveres) que adquirirá de la feria de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
Canelita Communal Bank will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Hub of Collpani.  It is made up of eleven members and it is governed by a board of directors, with Gloria as president.  The communal bank members have different kinds of businesses, among which are:  making fried foods, offering lodging, a corner store, a rotisserie, making empanadas, crafts, and a beauty salon.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small businesswomen, of whom Gloria is one.  She tells us that this is her first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, having joined after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business running a corner store; she tells us she started this business on her own initiative with a little capital and the desire to better herself.  

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital so she can buy foodstuffs at the fair in the city of La Paz, which she will then sell at her store.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family as best she can, as she is single and has three children.  
 
When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Natividad es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de chalecos, tienda de barrio, artesanía en mantillas, venta de coca, tienda de artículos varios, costura de mochilas, tejido de macramé y mantas, artesanía.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Natividad es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una socia que es participante en la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que trabaja hace años atrás, emprendiendo por recomendación de su comadre que le ayudo a equipar su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de enlatados, azúcar y aceite) que adquiere de las vendedoras por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Flor Kantuta" communal bank is about to start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office. The group is made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors. Their treasurer is Señora Natividad. The members' businesses are varied and include: sewing vests, a general store, making traditional baby clothes, selling coca leaves, a variety store, making backpacks, macrame and woven blankets, and crafts.
This loan will benefit these micro businesspeople. Natividad is one of these people. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago at the invitation of another member of the institution. She currently has a business running a general store. She has had this store for several years, and started it at the recommendation of her godmother who helped her to fit out the business.
