This loan is for increasing capital (buying canned goods, sugar, and oil). She will acquire these goods from the wholesale sellers and later sell them in her store. This work allows her to make an income to support her family where possible. She is married and has five children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health clinic.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, 35 years old, is married to Robert and has two children who are in primary school. For the past 3 years, she has operated a grocery store in Kiambu, earning a monthly income of 7,000 KES. This will be Cecilia's first loan with KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy assorted vegetables for resale. In the future, Cecilia wants to be successful in business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Maria Amalia

texts.es: María Amalia vive junto a sus tres hijos, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, embutidos, leche, pan entre otros, además adicional a esto vende pupusas que le ayudan a complementar los gastos del hogar, tiene experiencia en la venta y el negocio esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia en una colonia muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad, a buenos precios y con un servicio excelente; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y con muchas ganas de cumplir sus sueños, se esfuerza al máximo pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito, en las ultimas semanas noto un aumento en la demanda de producto y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, embutidos, pan, golosinas, bebidas, etc. María Amalia tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Amalia lives with her three children.  She owns a store where she sells basic consumer goods, staple grains, meats, milk, and bread among other things.  In addition, she also sells pupusas (traditional Salvadoran stuffed tortillas) which helps her to supplement her household expenses.  She has experience in sales and her business in located in her home in a busy, well traveled neighborhood.  She has many customers who prefer her business because all of her products are of first-rate quality, at good prices and with excellent service.  María is an energetic woman who is dedicated to her work and who has a great desire to  her dreams.  She puts forth her maximum effort because she knows that only in this way will she achieve success.  In the past several weeks, she has observed that the demand for her products has increased and she wants to take advantage of the opportunity to make a new investment, but she doesn't have sufficient capital.  Therefore, she has requested a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase staple grains, meats, bread, snacks, beverages, etc.  María Amalia has good credit references and is responsible.  She is certain that she will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time, she's confident that she will provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, meats, bread, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Gs Horizontes Del Porvenir 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Bertilia tiene 45 años de edad, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con ella vive su hija y su esposo quien la respalda en cada uno de sus compromisos, su negocio es venta de abarrotería en general, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años en su casa de habitación. Su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas es en grandes cantidades y esto hace que sea muy visitado.
Doña Bertila el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, frijoles, arroz, carnes, lácteos, pollo, refrescos, verduras etc. el impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que las ventas de su negocio crezcan, ya que comprara una gran cantidad de productos y así tendrá variedad  para cada uno de sus clientes, quienes visitan su negocio a diario.
Los planes a futuro de Doña Bertila es seguir creciendo en su actividad, y ser uno de los mejores negocios en su barrio de esta manera generarse mejores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Jasaira se dedica a la venta de baleadas y también tiene una mini pulpería
Wilson se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, sándwich y Jugos Naturales.

Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2012
texts.en:
Señora Bertilia is 45. She lives in the southern zone of Honduras with her daughter and husband. Her husband supports her in everything. She sells general groceries from her home, and has doing this for five years. Her business is located in a strategic area where a lot of people pass by; her business is very well-trafficked.
Bertila needs this loan for the purchase of: corn, beans, rice, meat, canned goods, chicken, pop, vegetables, etc. She hopes that the impact of this loan will be for her business' sales to increase, since she will buy a large quantity of products and thus have a good variety for each one of her clients who visit her business daily.
For the future, Bertilla plans to keep expanding her business and to have one of the best businesses in her neighbourhood. This way, she will generate a higher income and have a better quality of life.
Jasaira sells baleadas [flour tortillas folded in half with refried beans, cheese, cream, and other ingredients inside] and also has a small grocery store.
Wilson sells hamburgers, sandwiches, and natural juices.

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, rice, meat, canned goods, chicken, pop, vegetables, etc, for her business.

loans.name: Solidario Génesis Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Génesis:
Olga Marina de 45 años de edad es originaria de Chimaltenango, es una persona muy responsable y muy emprendedora ya que le gusta mucho vender y es la actividad que más le gusta, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad, desde hace varios años vende en el mercado municipal de su localidad, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de más productos comestibles de primera necesidad  para la venta ya que le falta artículos por tener ya que sus clientes le hacen pedidos y ella en veces no tiene los productos que le piden, espera que por medio del crédito le puedan ayudar a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Génesis Solidarity Group:
Olga Marina, age 45, is from Chimaltenango. She is a very responsible and enterprising person. She enjoys selling very much; it is her favourite thing to do. She has sold basic food goods in the local municipal market for several years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more basic food goods to sell, since she needs some stock. Her customers are making orders and sometimes she does not have the products that they request. She hopes that you will be able to help her get ahead through this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more basic food goods.

loans.name: Amistad Y Lucha Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María Luz es socia del grupo “Amistad y Lucha” (en la fotografía es la segunda al lado izquierdo, vestida con un chaleco de color rojo), un grupo integrado por seis socias que vienen trabajando juntas hace casi cinco años, unidas por un mismo objetivo: lograr una situación económica estable apoyándose en el trabajo y la inversión en sus negocios.
María Luz se dedica desde hace 19 años al negocio propio. Inició con la venta de gas en su domicilio. Posteriormente, con las ganancias obtenidas invirtió en la compra de bebidas y paralelamente inició su negocio de ventas de productos de belleza el cual le permitía relacionarse un poco más con sus vecinas y familiares y conocer gente nueva. Con mucho esfuerzo apostó en poner una bodega, la cual fue creciendo poco a poco y actualmente está surtida de diversos productos y es una bodega principal y muy concurrida en su zona.
María Luz invertirá el préstamo en la compra de productos de abarrotes para su bodega como aceite, leche, detergentes, etc.
María Luz tiene 49 años de edad, es casada tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos mayores de edad y uno pequeño de casi  9 años. Ella está muy agradecida por el préstamo ya que gracias a los préstamos anteriores ha logrado cumplir sus metas tanto en el aspecto comercial  como el familiar ya que gracias a los ingresos de su negocio ha podido apoyar en el pago de los gastos de la casa como de los estudios de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Sra. María Luz (pictured second on the left in the red jacket) is a member of the “Amistad y Lucha” group, a group of six women who have been working together for almost five years. They are united by the same goal: to achieve a stable economic situation and to support each other in working and investing in their businesses.
María Luz has had her own business for 19 years. She started selling pop from her home. Later, with her earnings, she invested in the purchase of other drinks. At the same time, she started a business selling beauty products. This has allowed her to get to know her neighbours and extended family better and to meet new people. She took a gamble in opening her general store, and she worked very hard. It grew bit by bit, and is now stocked with diverse products. It is one of the main stores in the area and is very popular.
María Luz will invest this loan in the purchase of groceries such as oil, milk, and detergents for her store.
She is 49 and married with three children. Two of her children are grown; the other is almost 9 years old. She is very grateful for this loan, since thanks to her previous loans she has been able to achieve both her business and personal goals. Thanks to the income from her loans, she has been able to help out with the household costs and with her daughters' education costs.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of grocery products.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья уже несколько раз пользовалась финансовой помощью, предоставленной КИВА. Предыдущий кредит помог Наталье расширить свой ассортимент товара, закупить детские куртки и ветровки. Благодаря прибыли, полученной от реализации товара, приобретенного на сумму, полученную от КИВА в последний раз, Наталья смогла продолжить строительство своего дома и почти закончила в нем ремонт, что давно казалось ей несбыточной мечтой.  
В этот раз Наталье необходима сумма в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить зимние головные уборы под реализацию. Работая в сфере рыночной торговли уже несколько лет, Наталья обнаружила, что в этот период смены сезонов очень важно начать наращивать ассортимент зимнего товара, потому что чем больше в него вложишь, тем больше потом можно получить прибыли.
texts.en:
Natalya has used financial assistance from KIVA several times already. Her last credit helped Natalya expand her inventory and purchase children jackets and windbreakers. Due to the increased profits from the sale of goods she purchased with the loan Natalya was able to continue improving her house and has almost finished renovating which has been her longstanding dream. 

This time Natalya would like to take out a loan of 4000 griven so that she can purchase hats for resale. Her experience in retail has taught Natalya that during the switching of the seasons it's important to quickly expand one's winter inventory, since the more one invests in it early the better the profits will be in the end.

loans.use: to buy winter hats for resale

loans.name: Rovelson

texts.en:
Rovelson is a hard-working husband and father to his two children. His wife is a teacher of the secondary level of education. Rovelson and his wife work together to generate better income for their family expenses.

Rovelson has been a hog raiser for three years. Aside from raising hogs, he also grows rice crops. He is indeed grateful because his wife is a supportive and industrious woman. 

Rovelson aims to have more hogs to raise so he can continually improve their way of living and educate his two children.

To make his dream come true, early in the morning he cleans his pigpen and gives his hogs proper nutrition to make them healthy. 

Since his business is growing, he is also in need of bigger capital to supply all the necessary hog feed and vitamins for his hogs. With regards to his situation, he has requested a loan of PHP 15,000.  He hopes to get his requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and 59 years old. She lives in Yahong, Tudela. Erlinda owns a plot of farmland where she plants bananas and root crops to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. 

Erlinda joined Kiva's partner GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Erlinda's plan is to save her returns in order to support their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is an industrious mother who helps her husband earn money for their family. She is 34 years old and has three children. She is engaged in the hog raising business. She wants to increase her sales, but financial difficulty hinders her from buying necessities for her hogs. As a result, she is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy feed, medicine, and vitamins for them.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vitamins for her hogs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julio Manuel

texts.es: Julio tiene 33 años de edad estado civil soltero, no tiene hijo. El cuenta que tomo un cursos de herrería y comenzó trabajando lo que es respecto al aluminio y eso le gusto por eso ahora , tiene un taller de aluminio .Con el préstamo él quiere  comprar mas herramientas y vidrios
texts.en: Julio, 33, is single and has no children.  He says that he took classes in metalworking, and started working with aluminum, which he enjoys.  He now has his own aluminum workshop.  With this loan, he wants to buy more tools and glass.

loans.use: to buy tools and glass

loans.name: Manuela Candelaria

texts.es:
la señora Manuela Candelaria esta casada, tiene 25 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduría, aprendí este negocio con su mamá hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de varias clases y colores, ya que quiere incrementar su producción de cortes típicos, espera en el futuro próximo tener varios empleados.
texts.en:
Manuela Candelaria is married, 25 years old, and completed six years of primary education. She has two children and one of them is in school. Manuela Candelaria is a weaver. She learned this business from her mother and has ten years of experience at this point.

She is requesting a loan that she will use to buy various types and colors of thread, as she would like to increase her production of traditional skirts. She hopes that in the future she can have employees.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: El Sr. Darwin tiene 27 años tiene un hijo de la edad de 5 meses, se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir junto a su hermano, su hermano le entrega las prendas recortadas y el Sr. Darwin solo realiza la costura, su taller se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Sewenkani, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Darwin va a usar este préstamo en la compra de una máquina de coser para  su negocio ya que esta época su demanda se incrementa,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo y también porque  su hermano quien es cliente de la institución fue quien le recomendó ya que se le atendió con calidez y agilidad que nos caracteriza, el Sr. Darwin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que hay en el mercado hay muchas personas que se dedican a la confección de prendas  de vestir y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir equipando su taller comprando otra máquina de costura que se llama collareta que es especializada para costurar los cuellos, su deseo del Sr. Darwin es que quiere sobresalir quiere llegar a tener su propio taller y sus propias maquinas y clientes y dejar que su hermano también trabaje solo, por ahora está empezando pero tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Darwin, 27, has a 5 month-old child.  He has a tailoring business with his brother.  His brother does the cutting, and Darwin is the one who does the sewing.  His workshop is located in the Sewenkani neighborhood.  This is his first loan with the institution.  Darwin will use this loan to buy a sewing machine for his business, because this is the season when the demand for his products grows.  The reason that he is requesting this loan is that he lacks cash, and because his brother, who is a client of the institution, recommended the institution to him because of the warmth and speed with which he has been treated.   Darwin faces challenges in his business, such as the competition in the marketplace, because there are a lot of people who work making garments.  He will use the profits that he gets to continue to equip his workshop, buying another sewing machine called a "collareta," because it is specialized for use in sewing collars. 

Darwin wants to succeed and eventually have his own workshop and his own machines and customers, leaving his brother to also work on his own.  For now he is starting out, but he has a strong desire to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Emma Silvia

texts.es: Emma Silvia vive junto a su familia en una comunidad urbana muy conocida y transitada, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, cosméticos, entre otros tiene varios años de trabajar en este negocio y tiene gran experiencia en las ventas lo cual le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela es muy conocida y las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; Emma es una mujer dedicada a su labor, entregada y muy enérgica, siempre esta luchando por encontrar las mejores alternativas que le den la oportunidad de alcanzar el éxito, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor, cosméticos, etc. Emma Silvia tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Emma Silvia lives with her family in a well-known and busy urban area. She sells women's, men's, and children's clothing and cosmetics, among other items. She has been working for several years and has gained much sales experience, which allows her to earn a good income. She has regular customers because she is well-known for her product quality, good prices, and excellent service.

Emma is dedicated to her work and very energetic. She has always sought better alternatives to achieve success. Demand has increased in recent months, and she wants to take advantage of this to increase her investment. She is applying for a loan with INTEGRAL to buy cosmetics, wholesale clothing, and more. Emma Silvia has good credit references and is very responsible. She is sure she can repay the loan and is confident she can offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru:
В последний раз, когда Тамара брала кредит КИВА, она, получив дополнительную прибыль, смогла приобрести новую бытовую технику. 
Тамара в очередной раз обращается в КИВА за кредитом в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонную женскую одежду. Полученные от использования в обороте средства она планирует пустить дальше в развитие своего бизнеса и помочь дочери развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en:
The last time she received a loan from Kiva, Tamara was able to use the additional income to acquire some new home electronic appliances.

This time, Tamara has turned to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 4,000 hrivnyas to purchase seasonal women's' clothing. She plans to put the proceeds received from utilizing the loan into the further expansion of her business and to help her daughter develop her own business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's' clothing

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь много работает. У нее есть место на рынке, где продаются женские пальто и шубы к зиме. Сейчас там работает продавец. 

Недавно Любовь открыла парекмахерскую, сделала там ремонт. Сейчас Любовь просит предоставить ей кредит на покупку отопительного котла для ее парикмахерской. 

Любовь - оптимист и всегда позитивно воспринимает любые вызовы. Любовь помогает сыну в покупке земельного участка под строительство дома.
texts.en: Lubov works a lot. She has a a store at the shopping center which sells women's fur and wool coats for winter. Lubov employs a sales person to manage the store. Recently Lubov opened a hair salon and started renovating the space. For this reason she wants to take out a loan from KIVA to purchase a heater for the hair salon. Lubov is an optimist and is always responding positively to all criticisms. She is helping her son to purchase a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase a heater for her retail space

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 34-year-old married male from Al Aqaba, Jordan. He has seven children and has requested a loan of 800 JOD to pay for his home improvement and painting expenses. He would also like to buy some furniture. Fadi is looking forward to improving living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvement expenses.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en: Phal is 45 years old and a resident living in a rural area of the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district of Cambodia.  She is a mother of two children, one son of whom is dependent on her and still in school.  Growing rice on 1.5-hectare of farmland and also planting oranges are the main sources of the family’s income, which she and her husband have been doing for twenty years.  The current business earns them about 28,000KHR per day and allows them to save around 10,000KHR each day after daily expenses.  Low crop yield resulted from drought is still the main challenge.  Phal’s group composes of four members who live in the same village and she is a new borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Now she is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Phal will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her plantation business.  With this loan, she hopes to get a better yield from her crop so as to keep up the good progress of her lifestyle, and keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her plantation business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old, married to Karen, and blessed with a seven year old child. He practices dairy farming which he ventured into three years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES. 8,000.

He has requested a third loan to purchase a dairy cow for efficient milk production. The anticipated profit will help him buy his cattle enough feed for the year. 

He dreams of stabilizing this business in order to have reliable income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for efficient milk production.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica, a 27-year-old  married mother of three, lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin where she has been operating a shop selling assorted ready-to-wear items for two years now. A member of PMPC for one  year, Veronica has requested a loan to purchase additional RTW's to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional RTW's to sell.

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: La Sra. Elizabeth  tienes 2  hijos,  actualmente es integrante  en la alcancía comunal “trabajando para el futuro”  grupo  conformado por  7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta y confección de billeteras en un taller propio, desde hace 4 años. Elizabeth trabaja muy duro junto a su esposo, hoy en dia tiene clientes fidelizados y su negocio sigue creciendo, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos van a la escuela y sobre todo cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida , con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar una maquina para remallar billeteras. Elizabeth cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo. Agradece a Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en: Elizabeth has two children and is a member of the "Trabajando para el Futuro" ("Working for the Future") Communal Bank, which has seven members who work in various commercial activities. Elizabeth has been selling and making wallets in her own workshop for four years. She works very hard, together with her husband. Today she has loyal customers and her business keeps growing. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she is earning more, her children go to school, and above all, they enjoy a better quality of life. With the goal of continuing to grow, Elizabeth is requesting a new loan to buy a machine for mending wallets. Elizabeth will reach her goals through a lot of work and effort and thanks to EDAPROSPO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a machine for mending wallets

loans.name: Pan De Vida Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Pan de Vida” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se  dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, manicure, feriantes, venta de comida rápida, venta de sopaipillas, venta de articulos plásticos, venta d manteles, articulos para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de la Pintana, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Jessica, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una polera de color negro y encima usa un chaleco de color Calipso, lleva puesto anteojos, de adorno una cadenita, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado.
Ella se dedica al rubro de impresiones digitales (La impresión digital es un proceso que consiste en la impresión directa de un archivo digital a papel, por medio de tóner), desde hace 2 meses. Comenta que trabaja en un local el cual arrienda y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra directamente a proveedores que se especializan en impresiones a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará tazones,tintas, alcancías, poleras para las impresiones.
Una de las metas de Jessica es habilitar otros locales y dar trabajo a otras personas, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Jessica vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 18, 17 y 10 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es darle lo mejor a sus hijos y un buen futuro para los estudios.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Respecto a las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
La Pintana es una comuna ubicada al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile), en la región Metropolitana. Se caracteriza por ser una comuna con altos índices de pobreza, donde más de un 10 por ciento de los habitantes vive en situación de indigencia. Por lo anterior, la autoridad local (municipalidad) se ha preocupado de desarrollar variados programas sociales enfocados a aportar al  mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de sus habitantes
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Pan de Vida and it is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, such as clothing sales, manicure, stallholders, fast food sales, fried pastry sales, plastic sales, table cloth sales, home decor, and services, among others.  They all come from the area of Pintana located in the city of Santiago.

Communal bank member Jessica is pictured sitting in the first row, second from the right, wearing a black sweater with a blue cardigan over it, glasses, a small chain, and dark brown hair pulled back.

She has been making digital prints for two months (digital printing is a process that consists of printing a digital archive directly to paper with toner).  She tells us that she works in a rented space and that she sets her schedule according to its availability.  

She buys the merchandise she needs directly from distributors who specialize in low-cost printing, which makes it a better deal.

With this loan she will buy coffee mugs, ink, piggy banks, and t-shirts for prints.

One of Jessica's goals is to help out other businesses and give work to other people, thereby generating more income and achieving a better quality of life.

Jessica lives with her husband and their three children, who are 18, 17, and 10 years old and who are all in school.  Her dreams for her family are to give her children the best and a bright future for their education.

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity Fondo Esperanza has offered her, as it will allow her to invest in her business.  As regards the communal bank she belongs to, she tells us that it has very good communication.  As far as the trainings go, they have helped her learn new sales and accounting strategies. 

La Pintana is a neighborhood located in the southern part of Santiago (Chile's capital), in the metropolitan region.  It is known for being a neighborhood with high instances of poverty, where over 10 percent of its inhabitants live in impoverished conditions.  Because of that, the local authority (municipality) has taken the trouble to develop several social programs focused on contributing to the improvement of the quality of life of its residents.

loans.use: to buy coffee mugs, ink, piggy banks, and t-shirts for prints

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old and a mother of two children. She operates a grocery store in Kiambu and has been in this business for eleven years. She has a monthly income of fourteen thousand shillings.

This will be Maria's first loan with KADET. She plans to use the entire loan to buy stock for her business, including green vegetables, tomatoes, and fruits. In the future she wants to be a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old divorced man and father of three children.  He works as a cook and sells special dishes of beans, chick peas and other related tasty plates.  Ali works hard to provide his children the best living, because he believes that they must live a normal life just like any child.  He puts so much effort into being their beloved and caring parent, as well as the working and supportive father. 
Just like most Palestinians living in Lebanon, Ali works hard to improve and expand his business as much as he can in order to improve his children's living, and provide them almost everything they need.
Ali has been an Al Majmoua borrower for nine consecutive cycles.  All of the previous cycles helped a lot in improving his working area, in addition to purchasing new furniture for his house.
What makes his business different is the special dishes he provides.  Most of his customers are neighbors and tourists visiting the historical Saida region.  It's just the bad security situation that affects his business development and he hopes that this will end soon.
Today he is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new refrigerator, plates, a new bean grinding machine, in addition to a TV and a washing machine for his house.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator, plates and new bean grinding machine.

loans.name: Liberita

texts.en:
Liberita is a 52 year old married woman with four children. The oldest child is thirty years old. Liberita has been in the hog raising business for  ten years. 

She plans to use the loan to buy additional piglets and feed. Each month she earns 8,000 pesos by doing the hog raising business. In the future, Liberita would like to expand her hog raising business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, age 37, is a loving mother of four children. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5, 000 to buy cooking oil, soy sauce, sugar, coffee, vinegar and soap. She will use this inventory in her store. Her customers are always looking for these goods. She hopes that her business will succeed so that she can save and provide for the growing needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, soy sauce, sugar, coffee, vinegar and soap.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe De Santa Clara Group

texts.es: ¡Saludos desde Perú!, Este es el grupo “Virgen de Guadalupe de Santa Clara”, el cual está conformado  por 7 integrantes. La Sra. Marlene es la primera persona que se ubica en la parte derecha de la foto con vestimenta azulina. Marlene es socia del grupo, es casada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, vive también con su pareja. La Sra. Marlene se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos, empezó con su negocio hace un año y recibe siempre el apoyo de su esposo. Marlene va a utilizar el préstamo para comprar mercadería y así poder abastecer su negocio.  El sueño de la Sra. Marlene es tener una cadena de "Farmacias" y el pago de los estudios de sus hijos. La Sra. Marlene con los demás integrantes del grupo le agradecen por la confianza y apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Greetings from Peru! This is the "Virgen de Guadalupe de Santa Clara" Group, which is comprised of seven members. Marlene is the first person on the right, dressed in blue. Marlene is a member of the group and she is married with two dependent children. She also lives with her husband. Marlene sells pharmaceutical products. She started her business about a year ago and has always had her husband's support. Marlene is going to use this loan to buy merchandise so that she can stock her business. Marlene's dream is to have a chain of pharmacies and to pay for her children's educations. Marlene, along with the other members of her group, are grateful for the confidence and support offered to them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for stocking her pharmacy

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley has a hog fattening business. Through this occupation, she can help her husband find finances for their everyday necessities. After four months, she is earning 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each hog. But if it is not healthy and meaty, it brings in lower prices.

Therefore, Shirley is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional hogs, feed and vitamins in order to maintain – or rather exceed – her usual proceeds. Providing necessities to the hogs will better nourish them and possibly earn higher income. She just hopes for further improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for a sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Aiceline

texts.en:
Aiceline is 23 years old and the mother of two children. To save for their educational needs, she engaged herself in the hog fattening business. She wants that her children not experience difficulty in schooling. So as early as now, Aiceline and her husband are already saving for the future of their children. 

She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feed and vitamins.  She assures you it will make her business progress.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru: Александр торгует на местном рынке «1000» мелочей. Этот местный рынок, на котором можно найти самые разнообразные хозяйственные и продтовары, очень популярен среди населения. Александр торгует на этом рынке сантехникой. Кредит Александру понадобился для поездки за товаром, для приобретения пластиковых труб, смесителей, кранов, плитки.
texts.en: Aleksandr sells at the "1000 Melochei" market. This local market, where one may find all kinds of household and food products, is very popular among the locals. Aleksandr sells plumbing supplies at this market. Aleksandr needs a loan to travel around for merchandise, to buy plastic pipes, faucets, taps, and tiles.

loans.use: to purchase plastic pipes, faucets, taps, and tiles.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 39 years old and married, wth six children. She is married to Joseph, a hog raiser. 

To add to her spouse's income, she is selling snacks, such as fish balls, hot dogs, and boiled eggs, to the people in their village. They both generate income so they will give the best education to all their children. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fish balls, hot dogs, and eggs to sell and help increase her income. 

Eva hopes to keep making their businesses profitable to save for her children's matriculation fees. They will be happy and proud to see them professionals in their chosen career someday, despite poverty in life.

loans.use: to buy fish balls, hot dogs, and eggs to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hog raiser in Lanna and has six children. She usually gains P4,000 for each hog sold. She is married to a farmer. 

Teresita would like to improve her sales but has insufficient funds. That is why she is asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy hog feed and medicines to ensure good nutrition for her hogs. It will help increase her sales upon disposal of the raised animals. In the future, Teresita would like to attain good profits to save funds for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and medicines to ensure good nutrition for her hogs

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly, a hardworking mother of four, is now 49 years old. To gain profits for her family's sustenance, she sews uniforms, curtains, and tablecloths. She has been doing it for nine years now. She is now asking for P7,000 to improve her output. She will buy thread and fabrics used in her sewing business for improvement.

Someday, she hopes to keep improving her sales and services so she can have more customers and increase her income, leading her to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabrics used in her sewing business

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is a married woman with three children. She is 50 years old and has been in the sari-sari store business for eighteen years. Florencia sells merchandise like noodles, sugar, coffee, and canned goods. Aside from her sari-sari store, she also has a motorcycle parts shop. Florencia is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more merchandise for her sari-sari store and parts for the motorcycle shop. In the future, Florencia hopes to expand her store and motorcycle shop in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business and to buy spare parts for her motorcycle shop

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en: Pilar is from Malibangcao, Ozamis City. She is 67 years old, married, and has ten children. To make a living, Pilar owns and operates a retail store. She has had her business for five years and earns 7,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Pilar joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee for her retail store

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle, 28, wants to earn enough money for her two children. Her eagerness to provide a better living causes her to request additional working capital of PHP 5,000. It will be used to buy feed and vitamins for her current hog. She hopes that it will make her hog healthier and is hoping that through this financial assistance, she can lift her family's poor living to better conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hog

loans.name: Donna Kerr

texts.en: Donna Kerr is 32 years old and lives in Locsoon,Tudela.  Donna Kerr is single and has four children. To earn a living, Donna Kerr has a business selling snacks in the community.  Donna Kerr earns about PHP 2500 each month doing this type of work. Donna Kerr has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Donna Kerr would like to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Alberto Lenin

texts.es: Alberto Lenin de 28 anos de edad, casado con 1 hijo menor de edad, Alberto  es un hombre muy trabajador, dedicado a su familia, responsable. Él tiene por actividad económica la venta de bisutería, o articulos para fiestas. Anos de experiencia en el negocio siete anos. Negocio que consisten en vender artículos como cintas, piñatas, vasos descartables, rompecabezas, festones, globos, recordatorio para piñatas, para comuniones. Alberto siempre ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El negocio surgió con un poco de ahorro personales y por la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo para poder sobrevivir con su familia. En la actualidad el necesita el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir con productos varios para brindarle mejor servicio a sus clientes, y mejorar sus ingresos. Alberto Lenin agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionista kiva a personas de escasos recurso y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Alberto Lenin, age 28, is married and has one minor child.  Alberto is a very hard-working and responsible man who is devoted to his family.

His business activity is selling party items.  He has seven years of experience in the business.  His business consists of selling items like ribbons, piñatas, disposable glasses, puzzles, scalloped trim, balloons, and commemorative items for piñatas and communions.

Alberto has always demonstrated his responsibility for paying on time.  The business emerged with a bit of personal savings and out of the need to have a source of work in order to be able to survive with his family.

He currently needs the loan to invest in work capital and stock up on various products.  This will give his customers better service, and it will improve his income.  Alberto Lenin is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have sources of decent work.

loans.use: to stock his business with party supplies.

loans.name: Rabeccah

texts.en:
Rebeccah, aged 42, is a farmer in Nkubu County, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and three children, of whom only one is in school. She has been in farming for over twenty years producing maize, peas, milk, and beans, which she sells locally.

She is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats, which will help her get more income, thus bettering her lifestyle and allowing her to educate her children. She believes that she will be the best producer of dairy goats in the near future.

Rebeccah says high costs of feed is her major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny, 40, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school, while the other two have their own employment. For the last twenty years, Vanny and her husband have been farming rice on one hectare of farmland as their main source of income. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee to gain extra income. Together, they can earn about 28,000 KHR per day through their current business. 

Vanny’s group consists of two members and she is the fifth cycled client, while her group member is the fourth cycled client, with VisionFund. The past loans, which she successfully repaid, have helped Vanny support her family with sufficient food. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Vanny, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy soil to refill the road to her house. This loan will enable her to have an accessible road with better conditions for commuting.

loans.use: to buy soil to refill the road to her house

loans.name: Sarafin

texts.en:
Sarafin is 38 years old and a farmer in Nkubu County in Kenya.  He lives with his wife and one child, who is three and is schooling, 

Sarafin has been in farming for three years, producing milk and tea.  He sells the tea to the Imenti factory and milk to the people around his local area. Poor markets for his products, pests, and diseases are his main challenges.

He is requesting a KES 30,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank and pipes for irrigation to help him improve his production.  More income will help him better his standards of living and educate his child.  He also aspires to buy his own car in future.

Sarafin says Juhudi Kilimo has very effective staff members.

loans.use: To buy water tanks and pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is applying for his third loan term with KADET LTD; he has repaid the previous loans successfully. Francis will use the loan to buy more stock of maize-meal, sugar and rice for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm, and educate his children. 

He hopes to open a wholesale shop in future which will help him get more profits and thus improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of maize-meal, sugar and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is from Lanchkhuti district, West Georgia. He is a 42 year-old, single man and lives with his mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Roman runs an agricultural business. In particular, he owns a garden where nuts and mandarins are grown. In addition, he sows maize on the family-owned agricultural land. Roman does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. Besides, Roman has bee-hives with bee colonies and gets honey. He sells his agricultural products at the local open market. Roman works hard to make some savings and expand his agricultural business.
He requested a loan to purchase treated wood for installation. He will build beehives himself and save money.  This will give Roman an opportunity to expand his business and increase his income. With the increased income, Roman will improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase treated wood for installation

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has been in poultry keeping and dairy farming for the past seven years and the business is doing well.

This will be her fourth loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, she wants to be a successful business lady and also raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, aged 48, is a farmer in Nkubu County, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and three children, one of whom is still in school. Alice has been in farming for over twenty years, producing maize, peas, and milk, which she sells locally.

She is requesting a 45,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry, which will help her have an additional source of income. This will assist her in educating her children. She aspires to be rearing a thousand fowls at any particular time but the high cost of feed is her major challenge.

Alice says that she is very grateful for the support from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 28 years old, married to Kipruto, and has been blessed with one child. She operates a beauty salon and has been running the business for the last three years. Her monthly income is KES 50,000.

Everlyne is applying for her third loan of KES 80,000 from KADET LTD. This will assist her in purchasing more electrical salon gadgets and massage products for her newer and larger premise.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business and increase her inventory. Her future dream is to have a stable business and income, which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase salon equipment and massage products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Teofanes

texts.en:
Teofanes is 42 years old, married, and has six children. His eldest child is eighteen years old. 

Teofanes had been in the charcoal business for two years. Teofanes earns 2,000 pesos through the charcoal business. This loan will be used to buy additional wood and coco shells to produce charcoal. In the future, Teofanes hopes to expand his charcoal business to support his family.

loans.use: to buy wood and coco shells for charcoal

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah, aged 30, is a farmer in Nkubu County, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and two children, who are both in school. Fridah has been in farming for three years, producing milk and vegetables, which she sells locally.

She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase animal feed in order to increase her animals' milk production, thus producing more income, which will help her pay for her children's school fees and better her standard of living. Poor climatic changes is Fridah's main challenge in farming.

Fridah believes that Juhudi Kilimo is the best micro finance organization for small-scale farmers.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with four children. Fe is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Fe is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase a hog. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her living conditions due her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hog

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 50-year-old married woman who has five family members. She is from Al-Hashmi-Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 JOD to buy children's and women's clothes to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area where she wants to increase her products. She hopes in the future to expand her project by opening a shop to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy children's and women's clothes to resell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 53 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. Jesusa is married without children. 

Jesusa has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for seven years. Jesusa requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. 
 
Jesusa has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to save money in case of an emergency.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents for her store

loans.name: Nina

texts.ru:
Нина уже 17 лет торгует мужской одеждой на выездных рынках города Мелитополя. Она хорошо знает данную группу товара, разбирается в брендах и качестве своей продукции.  
Нина обратилась в КИВА за кредитом в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар, а именно пуловеры, свитера и т.д. для последующей реализации со своей торговой точки.
texts.en:
Nina has been selling men's clothing at traveling markets in Melitopol. She knows this type of merchandise well, and is very familiar with the brands and the quality of their products.

Nina has turned to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 4,000 hrivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise, especially pullovers, sweaters, etc. for the next sale at her retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise, specially pullovers, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Ruth Chan

texts.en:
Ruth Chan is married woman who has three children. She is 32 years old, and lives in Kapalaran, Tambulig.  

Ruth Chan raises rice for sale, and she's been in this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns PHP 11,000 doing this type of work.

She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop. In 2010, Ruth Chan joined GDMPC. 

In the future, Ruth Chan wants to make improvements to her house, and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth, aged 34, is a farmer in Nkubu County, Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children, who are both in school. Kenneth has been in farming for five years producing milk, fruits, and vegetables, which he supplies to a board. He also does welding as an additional source of income.

He is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase materials to construct a zero grazing unit, which will help him feed his animals and improve their milk production. This will help him pay for his children's educations and better his standard of living. He plans to start selling cereals in the near future as an additional source of income. Drought and the high cost of farm inputs are his main challenges.

Kenneth says Juhudi Kilimo is the best micro finance institution for small-scale farmers.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Mrs. Bolor-Erdene is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a rented apartment in the northern province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver for the state railway station. Her daughter is six years old and goes to the secondary school, while her son is three years old and goes to the kindergarten. 

Mrs. Bolor-Erdene has worked as an assistant for a trade business of her friend's since 2006. Now she is starting to run her own trading business. She imports retail goods from China and sells to a small Russian town closer to the border. She requests a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more seasonal products in order to increase her profits and expand her business further. Her next goal is to build her own house. 

She is an open-minded and welcoming person.

loans.use: to purchase more seasonal products to increase her profits in her trading business

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce’s Group is made up of two ladies who are aged between 33 to 37 years. They both sell provisions and have been living in the same neighborhood for four years.

Joyce is a 33-year-old provisions seller who is single but has one daughter. Her daughter is 12 years old and is a junior high school student. They live together in a family house. Joyce operates her business at her residence, on the pavement. She sells between 7:30 am to 9:00 pm. This is her third loan with ID Ghana and she is requesting 900 Ghana cedis to buy more Milo, rice, sugar, biscuits, toffees, milk, and diapers.

Joyce and Patience (her group member) need an amount of GHS 1,700 to be able to buy more goods for their respective businesses. In 10 years' working experience, Joyce has not come across a good and flexible loan facility like that of ID Ghana’s.

She therefore wishes to build her own house in the near future out of this loan system and she is counting on Kiva’s support.

loans.use: to buy more Milo, rice, sugar, biscuits, toffees, milk, and diapers to sell

loans.name: Jollonar

texts.en: Jollonar is a 40-year-old married woman from Al Aqaba in Jordan. She has five children and requested a 400 Jordanian dinar loan to pay for opening a beauty salon inside her own home. In the future, she would like to expand her business and specify a room for it. She also wants to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for opening a beauty salon inside her home

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison, aged forty, is a farmer in Nkubu, Kenya, where he lives with his wife and two children, who are both in school. Harrison has been in farming for over fifteen years producing milk, maize, beans, and vegetables, which he sells to the local market.

He is requesting 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase water tanks and pipes for irrigation, which will help increase his farming production. It will also help him to better the education of his children and improve his standards of living.

Harrison says the high cost of feed and farm inputs are his main challenges.

loans.use: to buy water tanks and pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is applying for her second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Esther will use the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and animal feed.

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to expand the farming business by buying another farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and animal feed

loans.name: Precillana

texts.en: Precillana is from Kapalaran, Tambulig. She is 57 years old. Precillana is married and has 4 children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Precillana joined GDMPC. Precillana is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, for her rice farming business

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis tiene 21 años de edad, el vive en la ciudad de pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido ya cogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de maíz, algodón, entre otros. _luis en un joven muy trabajador, pero cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de barrio, pero lo que más le gusta es comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “ceviche Mixto”.  Debidos a motivos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración de empresas. 

Cada día Luis trabaja como mecánico, en una empresa de su ciudad, el realiza mantenimiento a la maquinaria pesada y por ello labora alrededor de 10 horas al dia; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene ganas de salir adelante.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar cemento, arena, pintura, entre otros materiales para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, con lo cual podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y poder seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener un gran negocio”.
texts.en:
Luis is 21 and lives in the city of Pisco. Pisco is characterized by its very warm climate. Although it is very dusty, it is an agricultural city. In particular, the residents cultivate corn and cotton, among other crops. Luis is a very hard-working young man, but when he has free time he greatly enjoys playing soccer with his friends and neighbours. His greatest pleasure is eating his favourite food, the rich "ceviche mixto". Due to economic factors, he was only able to stay in school until the fifth grade of secondary school. He would have liked to study business administration.
Every day, Luis works as a mechanic in a company in the city. He does heavy machinery maintenance and works about ten hours per day. He thinks that things are going well for him at work because he is very responsible and, above all, because he has a desire to succeed.
Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy cement, sand, paint, and other materials for making improvements to his home. This will allow him to provide his parents with a better quality of life and to continue working hard every day to make his greatest dream a reality: "To have my own home and to have a large business."

loans.use: with home improvements.

loans.name: Hellen Ibeth

texts.es:
Hellen tiene 21 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros. Helllen es una joven muy trabajadora, pero cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho hacer deporte, especialmente le encanta jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, pero lo que más le gusta es disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Caucau de Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo ha podido estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía, ya que le encanta cocinar.

Día a día Hellen trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el día; ella  cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene buena sazón.

Hellen está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar 2 mesas, sillas, pintado de local, entre otros, de esta manera podrá brindarle una mejor atención a los clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, para así seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Hellen is 21 and lives in the city of Pisco. Pisco is a city with a very warm, welcoming climate. It is an agricultural area where cotton and corn are cultivated, among other crops. Hellen is a very hard-working young woman, but when she has free time she greatly enjoys playing sports. She especially loves playing volleyball with her friends and neighbours. However, her favourite thing to do is to enjoy her favourite food, the rich "caucau de pollo". Because of her lack of economic resources, she was only able to stay in school up to the fifth grade of secondary school, but she would have liked to study gastronomy, since she loves cooking.
Every day, Hellen works in her food sales business. She works approximately ten hours per day and is able to serve up to 25 customers in one day. She thinks that things are going well for her in her business because she is very kind to her customers, and, above all, because her food is delicious.
Hellen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy chairs, two tables, and paint her business, among other things. This way, she will be able to provide a better customer service and improve her income. She will be able to continue to work toward realizing her greatest dream: "To have a large restaurant".

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and to paint her business, among other items.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is 60 years old and lives in Dolores,Clarin. Efren is married with 4 children. 

Efren has a store that sells dried fish in the community. Efren has had this business for 2 years, and has requested a loan of 25,000 to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Efren has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Efren hopes to improve his general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Edilma

texts.en:
Edilma is 64 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela. She is widowed and has 6 children. 

Edilma works in the fish industry, selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Edilma has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. Edilma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Edilma hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is from the village of Gauyabal. He is 53 years old. He is married to Elisa. Jose is engaged in the transportation business, using his motorcycle. He has been engaged in this business for many years. He usually receives an income of PHP 300 per day. Jose is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle. Jose still hopes to find ways to provide for his children's needs.

loans.use: to buy paint, wheels and gasoline for the maintenance of his transport motorcycle.

loans.name: Monica Celia

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica tiene 24 años tiene un bebe, ella se dedica a la fabricación  y venta de payasas (colchones de paja) este oficio lo aprendió de su madre y su hermana que se dedican a esta actividad hace ya varios años, ellas realizan su trabajo en su mismo domicilio  que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Kalajahuira, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Mónica va a usar este préstamo para la compra de paja y yute al por mayor para disminuir sus costos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de este material necesario para realizar su trabajo,  la señora es cliente del grupo Kalajahuira el cual es muy bueno y paga puntualmente, se le otorgo este crédito debido a que ella es muy responsable y puntual con sus pagos, la Sra. Mónica  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que en la zona en la que vive, muchos clientes se dedican a a la venta de colchones, y ella es pequeña productora, no cuenta con mucho capital para su negocio y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material como paja y yute al por mayor, su deseo  es el de  mejorar sus ingresos para poder conseguir sus propios bienes como muebles enseres y también su propio taller ya que actualmente utiliza el de su hermana.
texts.en: Señora Mónica is 24 and has a baby.  She makes a living by making and selling "payasas" (straw mattresses).  She learned how to do this from her mother and sister, who have done this work for several years.  They do their work in the same location, which is located in Kalajahuira.  This loan is her first with the institution.  She will use it to buy straw and jute wholesale to decrease her costs.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of cash to buy this material that she needs for her wrok.  She is a client of the Kalajahuira group, which is very good and makes its payments on time.  She was offered this credit because she is very responsible and punctual with her payments.  Mónica faces challenges with her business.  In the area where she lives, many people sell these mattresses.  Since she is a small producer, she doesn't have a lot of capital for her business.  She will use these benefits to keep buying materials like straw and jute wholesale.  Her dream is to improve her income to be able to obtain her own goods like furniture.  She also wants her own shop since she currently uses her sister's.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of straw and jute wholesale to decrease her costs.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Bethlehem Group

texts.es:
GRUPO SOLIDARIO BETHLEHEM
Este grupo está formado la líder del grupo Marta Alicia Vargas quien en su casa  tiene una pequeña tienda que le ayuda para seguir apoyando a su familia como actividad secundaria tiene la venta de leña,  el anhelo de ella es poder darle educación a sus hijos ya que están grandes y una va a empezar los estudios  básicos entonces necesita un poco mas de dinero y lo que gana su esposo no es suficiente para los gastos entonces solicita el crédito para poder surtir su tienda de productos comestibles de primera necesidad y comprar más leña ya que por mayor se lo dan un poco más barato  y su ganancia es mayor,  espera que puedan apoyarla para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Bethlehem Solidarity Group
The leader of this group is Marta Alicia Vargas, who has a small store in her home that allows her to continue to support her family. As a secondary activity, she sells firewood. Her desire is to provide her children with an education, since they are older and one is about to start her basic education. Because of this, Marta needs a bit more money since her husband's income is not sufficient for their costs. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to stock her store with basic food staples, and to buy more firewood; buying wholesale is cheaper and her earnings will be higher. She hopes that you will be able to support her in getting her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy basic staples and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooker and kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 22-year-old farmer from Nkubu County in Kenya. She is single with only one child. She has been farming for two years producing fruits and milk which she sells to the people around her locality. Drought, pests and diseases are some of her major challenges.

Betty is requesting a 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase dairy goats that will help increase her income; thus, uplifting her standard of living. She will also be able to educate her child. She looks forward to opening a cereal shop in the near future as an additional source of income. Betty says Juhudi Kilimo has very affordable interest rates for small scale farmers.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is a married man and he has four children. His oldest child is twenty nine years old. He is 57 years old and has been in the sari-sari store business for thirty years. Fidel sells merchandise like canned goods, detergents, soaps, and toiletries. Aside from the sari-sari store, he also sells tuba- a red wine made from coconut. 

Fidel has request a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise, to buy fertilizer for  bananas, and to buy tungog-a tanbark extract from mangrove species (an ingredient contributing to the nice color of the tuba). In the future, Fidel hopes to expand his business in order to support his family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as soaps, detergents, canned goods and toiletries; to buy fertilizers for the banana, and tungog for making tuba (coconut wine).

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is a 31 year old  man, married with one son. He grows fruits and vegetables in his garden, something he has been doing for the last 8 years. He is very experienced, as a farmer, and has deep knowledge of the land and how to operate it.  He was not able to finda  job for several years and decided to start his own business.  

Yashar usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for profitable prices in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also, one of the favorite national dishes is Dolma, a dish made of fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. His monthly income from this business is 350 AZN. Yashar`s wife is working as school teacher and also helps her husband.

Now Yashar would like to invest more capital into his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers. For this purpose he has applied for 1200 AZN. This is only one source of income for his family and he hopes that this loan will improve the quality of life for his family. This will be his 3rd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Solidario El Éxito Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO EL ÉXITO
INTEGRADO POR IRMA LETICIA, ELLA ACTUALMENTE ES PROPIETARIA DE UN PREDIO DONDE SIEMBRA MILPA (MAIZ) ES UNA PERSONA MUY EMPRENDEDORA LA CUAL HA LUCHADO JUNTAMENTE CON SU ESPOSO PARA PODER TENER LO Q HASTA EL DIA DE HOY HAN LOGRADO ELLA TIENE UN SUEÑO GRANDE QUE ES PODER SEMBRAR MUCHO MÁS QUE LO QUE SIEMPRA ASTA AHORA PARA PODER AYUDAR A SUS HIJOS Y PODER CONTRIBUIR CON SU ESPOSO ELLA TIENE 4 HIJOS A LOS CUALES TIENE ESTUDIANDO ELLA NO SOLO DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS SE QUEDEN DONDE ESTAN SI NO QUE SE CONVIERTAN EN UNIVERSITARIOS PERO PARA ELLO, ESTA CONSIENTE QUE DEBE APOYAR MUY FUERTEMETE A SU ESPOSO POR LO QUE EN ESTA OCASIÓN TOCA  LAS PUERTAS DE KIVA PARA PODER ADQUIRIR UN PRESTAMO DE ANTEMAMO ESTA AGRADECIDA YA QUE ESTO LE AYUDARA A SALIR ADELANTE.ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CRÉDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE SEMILLAS Y ABONO PARA EL CULTIVO.
texts.en: Irma Leticia is a member of the group, "Solidario el Éxito."  She owns a piece of land where she grows corn.  She is a very enterprising person, and she has fought along with her husband to be able to have what they do today.  Her big dream is to be able to plant a lot more than what she always has to be able to help her children and to contribute to their family's income with her husband.  She has four children, who are in school.  She hopes that they keep studying and go to college.  To do that, she knows that she has to support her husband very much.  This is why she is knocking on Kiva's door to obtain a loan.  She is grateful in advance since it will help her get ahead.  She is requesting this loan to buy seeds and manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure to grow corn.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 41 years old and married with one child. She lives in Lupagan, Clarin in the Philippines.

Ellen is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Ellen has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase piglets and additional feed.

Ellen has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Ellen hopes to be able to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and additional feed.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has a good credit history with KADET LTD.  He has been selling firewood  and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET LTD, after repaying his previous loans successfully. 

Simon will use the loan to buy more firewood for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for his business.

loans.name: Ezequiel Natusalen

texts.es:
Ezequiel tiene 30 años de edad, es padre de un hijo de 3 años de edad, quien se ha convertido en lo más importante para ella, ya que lo ama muchísimo y día a día se esfuerza por darle una vida digna a pesar de los problemas que se puedan presentar y junto a su esposa le dan mucho amor. Ezequiel vive con su familia en la ciudad de Pucallpa, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo tiene paisajes muy bonitos y sobre todos sus pobladores son muy alegres y generosos. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre a Ezequiel le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos del barrio y en ocasiones le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Chilcano de Carachama”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Ezequiel solo ´pudo estudiar hasta el segundo grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera e mecánica automotriz.

Día a día Ezequiel trabaja en su parcela de cultivo de cacao, el le dedica a su sembrío alrededor de 9 horas al día, el cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es le gusta mucho lo que hace y sobre todo porque es responsable.

Ezequiel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros para mantener su cultivo, de esa manera el podrá tener una mejor cosecha y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir adelante para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y tener más parcelas para cultivar”.
texts.en: Ezequiel is 30.  He is the father of a three-year-old son, who has become the most important thing in his life.  He loves him very much and strives every day to give him a worthy life despite the problems that can come up.  Together with his wife, they give him a lot of love.  Ezequiel lives with his family in the city of Pucallpa, which has a very warm climate and pretty landscapes.  Its people are very happy and generous.  In his free time, Ezequiel likes to play soccer with his friends from the neighborhood.  On occasion, he likes to enjoy one of his favorite meals, "Chilcano de Carachama."  Due to his scarce resources, Ezequiel could only study through his second year of secondary school, but he would have liked to become an automobile mechanic.  Day after day, Ezequiel works on his land growing cacao.  He does this for nine hours a day.  He believes that his business is going well because he likes it a lot and he is responsible.  Ezequiel is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help, he will be able to buy manure, fertilizers, and other items to maintain his crop.  In this way, he will be able to have a better harvest and to improve his income.  This will let him get ahead and make his biggest dream a reality:  "to give a good education to his son and to have more land to farm."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, etc.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 41 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte in the Philippines.

Beverly buys and sells rice to earn a living and has been in this business for two years. Each month she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Beverly has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Beverly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy owns and runs her retail store. She has run this kind of business for more than 10 years. She is thankful because her gained profit was used to give her children an education and to pay for basic commodities and the monthly electric bill. 

Mercy wants to buy basic merchandise, such as cooking oil, sugar, milk, shampoo, bar soap, dish washing soap, and other necessities.  According to her, her customers buy this merchandise every day. So she is seeking financial support amounting to PHP 10,000. 

She is hoping that she can eventually improve her retail store through this loan.  In that way, she can let her children finish their studies and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy basic merchandise, such as cooking oil, sugar, milk, shampoo, bar soap, dishwashing soap, and other necessities to re-stock her retail store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, who is engaged in a hog fattening business, is applying for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase feed, vitamins and one hog. She just hopes that her hog will this time have a healthier and nourished body to make a higher income. With her tirelessly promoting their lives, she is looking forward to the improvement of her income through her availed loan.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and one hog

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
